review.author: Olivia W.
review.description: This is where my daddy works! Friendly place for the most part. Strictly for workers and ASD personnel. Working for them isnt to bad either. Both of my parents work for the district and I did last summer for a job in maintenance. Really had a good time for a job!

name: Tanana Vly Campus-University of Alaska Downtwn Ctr

review.author: Austin H.
review.description: Fort Richardson Education Center offers lots of services for Military members and Families.  The Library on the main floor has a good movie and TV DVD section for checkout. The second floor has several College partners for people wanting to further their education.  \n\nThere is also a great coffee shop at the entrance that is a life-saver when you are stuck in long classes.

review.author: Shane E.
review.description: Excellent, clean, and well-staffed.  I appreciate the attention to detail and the care given to the kids that attend.

review.author: M B.
review.description: Staying open during a pandemic is putting all of your employees and all of the people they live with at risk. Why do you think schools shut down? Because kids will spread this infection faster than anyone else. I highly doubt you're going to be able to enforce social distancing on children, nor will you be able to keep them in groups 10 or smaller. Taking temperatures isn't enough.You are a disgraceful money hungry corporation, and you clearly don't care about the families who's children you care for or your employees.

review.author: Stephanke H.
review.description: They do the bare minimum... especially with the infant care. They lie and say that they will get their regular teachers but they put the infants in with whoever to save themselves money on actually paying the infant teachers overtime or good pay... really regretting putting my infant daughter into this program. Terrible front desk service and the only teacher I'd trust is Miss Patty. The other ones are constantly on break or never to be seen. I had high hopes for this place but was quickly shown how it really is.! DONT sign your INFANTS up here. They just care about the money not the baby!! \nAnd to top it off, after I paid half months tuition and gave them my two week withdrawal notice they still want me to pay them another 180.00 dollars.

review.author: Nathan T.
review.description: Very unprofessional, uncouth, and unkind.  This establishment certainly puts the "it" in "lack of commITment."  I would consider giving this establishment a second chance, but unlike them, I take childcare seriously.

review.author: C J.
review.description: Our son has been going to Bright Beginnings since he was four months old and we could not be more pleased with his level of care there. Days are structured, food is good, any issues are swiftly dealt with, and he absolutely adores his caregivers. \n\nWe looked at several other daycare providers and Bright Beginnings was the obvious choice.

review.author: Meagan H.
review.description:
Apparently Bright Beginnings does not acknowledge unique parenting situations.

My stepson attends Bright Beginnings, due to the wishes of his biological mother; I often drop him off and pick him up. Recently, after checking him out at the door and being informed that there was a message at the desk, I checked in with the receptionist to see what had happened. 

She informed me there was an incident report but refused to let me see it, read it, or sign it, despite the fact that I have signed three separate reports in the past. The receptionist said that they prefer the child's "real parents" provide a signature.

I have been a part of my stepson's life since he was only a few months old. This incident was an insult and was beyond disrespectful to me and my role in his life.

Not only that, but several times, upon picking him up, he has had a soiled diaper caked onto him. Of course, this always results in horrendous diaper rash and is extremely painful for him.

Save yourself the trouble and find another childcare situation for your children.

review.author: Mekayla T.
review.description: My 1 1/2 year old daughter has been going here for less than 2 months. It's over priced, the staff was extremely rude, and so far she has been neglected and ignored. Two weeks ago she had a severe double ear infection (with no call to me about her symptoms), when I walked in to pick her up at the end of the day, her hair was matted to her tears, her nose was running into her mouth, and she was screaming while sitting on the floor with a teacher standing by doing paperwork. Last week I had to take a day off because she had contracted pink eye. Now today I was phoned at work to find out she had "tripped" and she has 2 chipped teeth. I chose a center over a private home for safety issues and this is NOT what I paid extra for! Her clothes are always stained, she's always very hungry when she is picked up and I've had to call into work 3 times now, add that to what I've spent in Dr's visits and medication...

review.author: Jenny S.
review.description: Bright Beginnings recently moved to family style dining where the kids serve themselves and pass the shared dish to a friend. I was skeptical that 2-year-olds could handle that. I've been pleasantly surprised at how much of a difference it's made at home! My daughter eats more since she has some control and knows how to control her portions. Others have commented on how well she does at the dinner table as well.

review.author: Jason B.
review.description: DO NOT TAKE YOUR CHILD HERE -Total lack of structure and supervision - my child is a very outgoing person and always makes new friends - He was scared every day going to this place - he would be crying every day we picked him up and when we asked him about the "adults/caretakers" and what they did for the day, he would just start crying again and not want to say anything - Also be warned, they dont tell you that you have to give a written notice if you plan on leaving - Apparently it is lost somewhere in the fine print of the application but do they tell you about it? NO - The last month we paid for, my child never even went - Now I get it we paid for that month so I didn't expect anything back - However, we were then charged for another month because we didn't give written notice - On top of that, we were never notified of the charge and they sent us to collections 6 months later - When I called them I was told that it wasnt their problem and they called us - I would NEVER recommend you take your child to this establishment

review.author: Ivy P.
review.description:
Great and super caring teachers at Eye Level of Anchorage. They tailor the teaching materials and environment for my daughter. 

Moreover, during the monthly gathering, they encourage and provide a stage for kids to do talents shows. My daughter found herself audience at eye level. Love to practice and give her piano recital there once a month ever since. 

It definitely boost up my kid's confidence, courage, and her interactions with other people. We are happy to learn from Eye Level. Highly recommend for those who want to do extra curriculum on Math, English, and Korean.

name: St Elizabeth Ann Seton Catholic School

review.author: Henry M.
review.description: As an attendant of this school through 2017-2022 I can say that that are behind in education. Normally catholic schools are a grade or two above public schools but I feel like they are like 0.5 year's behind in education. But there is nice teachers and students. I don't really recommend this school.

review.author: Maddie M.
review.description: We have thoroughly enjoyed our experience at SEAS. The staff know all of the children. It is a warm, safe, and secure environment where young children have an opportunity to prosper.

review.author: Brian L.
review.description: Beautiful church and very lively parish. I always love to catch mass here. The people are very friendly and welcoming.

review.author: Jennifer G.
review.description: Small classes, truly amazing teachers and staff, heavily involved parents, founded in Catholic faith, and attached to and supported by our local Catholic Church. This school has everything we wanted for our children. We couldn't be happier and highly recommend St. Elizabeth Ann Seton School to all our friends, family, and those seeking a high quality education for their children.

review.author: Casey H.
review.description: I love taking my daughter to classes at ACBA. The staff are kind and professional. My young daughter has learned ballet skills while having fun with her friends. She loves her costumes and recitals that her class performs at the end of the session.

review.author: Ange B.
review.description: The class structures for the kids here is wonderful.\n\nThey are very punctual and are serious about the business, which is how it should be going through a dance academy.

review.author: Anna K.
review.description: This a serious school l. They teach kids, and adults, good alignment and proper technique. I studied with ACBA in my late teens and was able to get into the Jofferey school through New School University and BalletMet  Ohio as an apprentice. AND...the best part is even if you don't want to be a professional you will learn life long skills of disipline, performance and team work!! Michaelangelo and Farah are a gift to the Anchorage community!

review.author: Vivian L.
review.description: I studied with this company back in high school and they helped with e v e r y t h i n g (math, English, SAT, ACT, and even applying to undergrad colleges & scholarships). They really encouraged me to set high goals and supported me to achieve those goals-- I am eternally grateful. \n\nBy spending my time at Dr. Park's Academy, I was able to have all of my questions answered and followed by detailed explanations. It was obvious they cared about my edification. With their help, I was able to develop better study habits and skills that I carried with me to undergrad. I graduated from the University of California San Diego and will be starting my professional study at the University of California Los Angeles School of Dentistry. Thank you to Dr. Park's Academy because I would not be where I am today without them!

review.author: Lina Y.
review.description: Dr. Park was a huge help in my academic progress. From elementary to high school, I was able to soar in education  (AP Calculus, AP Chemistry, SAT, ACT, etc) with the help of Dr. Park's Academy. In my senior year of high school, I received tremendous help applying to college (Northwestern University, which I will attend this upcoming fall) was difficult but made easier with the help of Dr. Park.\nThe SAT prep helped me achieve a score of 1530 and a  34 in ACT. Furthermore, I was able to participate in group study sessions and private sessions that helped me tremendously in all subjects. Without the help of Dr. Park, taking numerous AP classes in addition to participating in sports and other after-school activities, all while maintaining a good academic performance would not have been possible. Overall, the academy greatly helped me stay on schedule with school (all throughout high school!), test prep (ACT, SAT, other school tests), applying to colleges, and scholarships.

review.author: Dahyon K.
review.description:
When I was in high school preparing for the SATs, I prepped with this company. 

The academy's college prep program was a great help to me and with it, I was able to get into the colleges I aimed to get into. Despite helping you with SATs, they also were able to help me and give me ideas on how to apply to colleges. The academy wants to help you get into the college that you want to get into and truly care for your education. 

Although I did not end up attending my top choice colleges due to their high tuition fees and not enough scholarships, I was able to get a very good financial aid packet at Creighton University with a 2-4 Pharmacy program which allowed me to be closer to my goals of going to Pharmacy School. 

I truly recommend this company. Without their SAT prep class, I don't think I would've been able to get into the college of my choice or get a good scholarship. They stress a good education and prepare you to become a successful person inside and outside of school.

review.author: JD C.
review.description:
I prepped with this company back in the early days before it was a bigger company, and now I tutor here.  It's great to see growth.  I'm going to give an un-biased report:

I scored around a 2300 through prepping here, back when the "new" SAT was new.  I took the SAT once on my own and prepped through 2 more SATs here, and after prepping with them, obtained a perfect score on the Writing.  I also ACT-prepped here twice and got a 34 (out of 36).

The Academy helped plan my academic path early on and naturally, I used their college prep services, and got into Columbia University, University of Chicago, Northwestern, Georgetown, etc (oddly enough, I was waitlisted at University of Washington in St. Louis, though lol).  It came down to Columbia and Northwestern, but I ended up going to NU.

One thing I must emphasize about their college prep program is that it is truly comprehensive.  Like, they help you from A to Z and beyond.  Their philosophy is "Let me help you get your kid into his/her Harvard," but they don't stop there.  They aggressively focus on scholarships.  I got a full ride merit-scholarship into Northwestern (whereas, ivy league schools don't usually give scholarships but are great with financial aid if you need a lot of it).  So, at first, I was a bit sad not to go to Columbia, but in the end and looking back, I was really pleased that I walked out of college debt-free AND got a stellar education.
(P.S.- back in the day, Columbia was ranked #9 and Northwestern was #11, so it made little difference ranking-wise where I chose to go.  In 2013, Columbia is at #4).

So, even though I may SOUND biased, I mean, I did walk out with fantastically improved scores, a fantastic college prep package, and got into my absolute top choice schools.  I got results--and not just any, but the ones I wanted.
I am not writing this because I work here, or because I was asked to.  I try to be a very honest person in life, and I would never have chosen to work here if I didn't think their services or philosophy was up to par.  The truth is, I decided to teach here because I agree with the philosophy and practices.  They truly care about education and each student.  I've seen the founders help less privileged students by writing off hours and giving them scholarships, and I saw them do this before the company became bigger--usually the time of initial "company growth" is not the time most business people act so generous.  They're not in it for the money, they're in it because education makes the world a better place.  Their kids both went to phenomenal undergraduate and graduate programs but are working/will be working in the public service sector.

Trust me, and not just because I work here (though, it should encourage you to come, as I did score in the 99% and am one of their best tutors), if you are passionate about your education and being/becoming successful, you want to be here.  There is no other place you'd personally want to be, or send your kid.  I'll be using their services again for graduate school entrance prep.

review.author: Sam B.
review.description:
Just finished the Aircraft Crash Survival course. It was excellent! Being prior military, I really appreciated the format, delivery, and even the content. It's very interactive and hands on training. You end up testing yourself a little in the pool inversion part. Very fun.

More importantly, I got a ton of useful real world knowledge that I had none of before. The instructors are very professional and keep it fun. Martin in particular was excellent. 

Top notch training delivered by top tier guys.

review.author: Lee J.
review.description: We took the Midnight Sun Photo Excursion on our Alaskan vacation, and we couldn't have been happier. We were two of four people on the excursion and had FAR less photography experience than the other two people on the tour. Our photo guide Eva was incredible, patient, and an amazing teacher. She taught us how to take amazing photos on the phones that we brought. At no point during discussions of lighting, framing, color, and shutter speed did we feel neglected or talked down to, both of which are easy to do when teaching a mix of novices and and experienced amateurs. We came away from the excursion with some of the most amazing photos of our trip and the memory of an incredible end to the best day of our Alaskan vacation. I cannot recommend Denali Photo Guides, and our guide Eva in particular, enough.

review.author: Lee S.
review.description: Our two daughters have grown and flourished so much since starting at PNA a few years ago.  They have engaged in so many cool and interesting science projects and field trips, and they get to do so many awesome things!  They do science and music and Spanish with awesome teachers, and we get lots of communication from the class.  We love the routines and the social environment the kids get to enjoy that keeps them on a great track academically.  \n\nWe would recommend this school to anyone!

review.author: No N.
review.description: My child went to this school about three, four years ago. It was our neighborhood school and as far as schools go, our worst experience. My kindergartener at the time was being heavily bullied at this school. As far as I am aware of this mostly happened during the breaks. The noon duties are too busy chatting, so they are unable to properly supervising our children. I am still a young parent, so I have lots to learn. I didn't know that elementary kids are that mean.. nor was I sufficiently involved in the whole school thing.. I am too consumed into work and being stresses and tired.. I lost out of sight what really matters. Looking back, that is a huge regret! I thought my son was in a safe place. He was not. Beyond being bullied, he was assaulted more than once. He was pushed off the equipment on the playground and nobody noticed. My son had a concussion. Nobody noticed. The noon duty did not apologize. The principal did reach out... mr Agnaiak is the name, I believe.   When I approached my sons teacher about it, the response was "so, are you saying that the duty was not doing her job?" Shy as I was back then, I said no... but I should have said yes. Yes, your noon duties were not doing their jobs. Or my son would not have suffered on your premises. I'm sorry that I took him to this school. And I'm sorry that I was ignorant, I had no idea that sensitive or shy children get no guidance or protection by teachers and just how mean a lot of our children are. You parents need to spend more time with your children and raise them properly! Your kids are bananas!\nBut, yes my five year old have a concussion on your premises.. and he was assaulted by a class mate. A student pushed him on he ground, pushed his face into the snow and sat on his head... my son looked sad when I picked him up, so I asked him what was wrong, and that is what he told me. I approached the duty about it and the only thing she said was "I cannot tell you the names of other students m" or something like that. That was not the response I was expecting, so I did not know what to say. My son told me who the child was, so I told the grandmother that was picked the kid up.. the school would have done nothing. They do a sucky job at protecting your kids!!! I should have known when I was signing my sons up and there was a kid in the nurses room because a student had rammed a pencil into his neck.. oh my gosh.. I know you can't say only bad things about the school.. but a few other things do come to mind. This school needs parent volunteers, the school is sort of out of control of the students.. I don't know what else the problem would be?   Thinking back makes me sad and angry. I know I did not speak up back then, when I should have. I was not thinking the right way! But I emailed the principal about this two years ago, and I received no response.. shows how much they care..\nAlso did I mention to the principal that I watched an elder female teacher pull a student around by the shoulder.. I should have said something too when I saw it back then.. I was just young and stupid. I'm sorry I put my son in your hands. Very. An upset parent of a former student.

review.author: Rita H.
review.description: This unique shop is a must stop location during your visit to Fairbanks. We were so thankful we had room in our carryon to take these unique, locally made, gifts home to our family and friends. \nThe customer service was genuine and knowledge of their vendors was so refreshing. It was a blessing to support this local business.

review.author: Millie E.
review.description: The service at Expressions in Glass is exceptional.  Debbie made an amazing star tree topper for us from stain glass.  The prices for custom work at this shop are very reasonable.  They have very beautiful gifts and practical items.

review.author: Foodi E.
review.description: Decided to try something new for a date night.  Had a blast twisting glass.  Small enough class that we got a lot of one on one with the instructor (Debbie and Joe) were patient and very knowledgeable.  We would really recommend this experience to try something new.

review.author: Terri S.
review.description: Love this shop! I bought a beautiful necklace and earring set for my mom for $29.99. They wrapped and shipped it! From beautiful hand made art to jewelry, cards, and gifts from all over. A friend and I took an art class here and made fused glass wind chimes. So much fun and I learned a ton! This is a fun shop with all price points covered.

review.author: Carrie N.
review.description: Favorite shop in town! Full range of prices, lots of local work, very knowledgeable, and free gift wrap!

review.author: Jason S.
review.description:
I wish I could give them 6 stars! Ronn and Marketa were amazing with us. We happened to reserve some really bad weather nights. Rather than taking our money, Ronn called me and was honest that he felt that the weather would not cooperate with seeing the Aurora and canceled our reservation. They were fully booked for the rest of the week with our clients and couldn't fit us in on any other day. They almost NEVER cancel a reservation because they are professionals that know what they are doing and will drive a hundred miles or more if needed; just in our case, the weather was bad everywhere in the area.

I had mentioned that it was my wife's dream to experience the Aurora and she has stage 4 gastric cancer. He had felt so bad and they were so generous as to let us meet them as their secret place on another night. We extended our stay 2 more nights to hopefully see it. They helped set up my camera (Sony Alpha 6000 with Rokinon 12mm F2.0 Lens) and chatted with us for a few minutes to make sure we knew what we were doing and everything.

Even though they canceled our reservation they still took a few portraits of us and helped us fulfill my wife's dream. She cried as she experienced the aurora saying it was the most beautiful thing she had ever seen, and now I'm tearing up just writing this review for the kindness and generosity of Ronn and Marketa.

All the locals, from the ER nurse at the hospital to restaurant owners and other tour operators, recommend Aurora Chasers. When even the locals recommend them you know they are good. They are top of the line for experiencing the aurora. Even though we never went in it they have a very nice passenger van to accommodate their guests. Also, don't leave early, stay out late. We were just about to leave when the aurora popped out of nowhere and was the most brilliant dance we've ever seen.

Attached are the photos they took of us.

review.author: Don O.
review.description: The best. They know the auroras and the cameras. With Ronn and Marketa's assistance we got great pictures and had a memorable evening. They are knowledgeable and super helpful.

review.author: Lance H.
review.description: The guides are extremely friendly and knowledgeable on multiple types of SLR cameras.  Clean comfortable van. Great approach to finding the best viewing.  Willing to work hands on with every guest to get the best pictures.  I highly recommend Aurora chasers.

review.author: Christi S.
review.description: Ronn and Marketa do an amazing job with their tour! They are very organized and spend the time to educate about the aurora borealis and the camera settings you need to take great photos. They walk you step-by-step through the process of getting your settings correct on your camera, and they also explain why these settings are needed. Their excitement about the aurora and teaching others how to photograph it makes it such a wonderful tour.

review.author: Helen C.
review.description: Ronn and Marketa made our night an unforgettable experience. We were aware that the Aurora was weather dependent and we had come at a bad time to see the lights but they made our night special. It was overcast and snowy so we weren't able to see the lights initially but they took us to an amazing location, we otherwise never would have discovered. We happened to get extremely lucky on the drive back into town and the skies cleared up for us to stop and see the lights. The experience was incredible and it was only because of how amazing they are and their talented photography skills . They were so nice and accommodating and worked really hard to give us a great night. I would highly recommend them! We are definitely going to be coming back.

review.author: Leslie B.
review.description: Marketa and Ronn went out of their way to make sure we had an amazing experience!! We got extremely lucky and we were able to see the lights. They were so nice and made sure we were safe and comfortable. 10/10

review.author: Anna L.
review.description:
AMAZING EXPERIENCE!
Ronn and Marketa are the best! 
We were booked through Make A Wish for February 14 from 9PM-3AM.  As soon as it was booked Ronn sent me an extremely detailed email and link to their website in early November-thank goodness. If he hadn't, we would never have been able to prepare for this once in a lifetime opportunity (we'll probably go again, but there's no time like your first time).  
To begin with: DO NOT WEAR COTTON- don't even bring it to Alaska in winter.  I suggest shopping for winter gear in early to mid November before your trip.  And unless you live somewhere that has bitterly cold winters, you will have to shop online because sunny LA does not stock what we needed in stores.  There are gear rentals in Alaska, but I didn't want to chance them not having our sizes and I want to do more winter travel so having our own gear will be nice.  Follow Ronn's list of suggestions & you'll be warm.
It was between -38 and -8 the week we were in Fairbanks. -42 with the windchill the night we were out for this gorgeous night.   All 3 of us wear eyeglasses: 3 blind mice.  The balaclava was hated by all 3 of us.  Your hot breath shoots straight up and fogs and then frosts you're lenses.  You won't be able to see.  If you pull it down and expose your nose, you'll avoid this, but risk frostbite. Also, once the balaclavas got moist , they stayed moist /wet and added to the cold.  Better option were fleece neck warmers and wool hats (the Peruvian ones are fantastic with flaps for your ears). I found that if I put a hand on my nose, under my glasses I could force my breath out instead of up and maintain vision.  If you know of a better solution let me know.  None of the eyeglass wearing Alaskans were able to give us a solution.
Back to the Aurora:  This is a photography class at first.  That being said, once the photography lesson is over (30 minutes max) & those that are shooting have their cameras properly adjusted (Ronn shows you how), everyone is outdoors staring up at the star riddled sky.  Our night was clear.  Those that weren't shooting we're doing the same thing as those of us with cameras: marveling at the night sky and waiting for the show to begin.
When it did, Marketa starts shooting photos of everyone- singles, together, poses, whatever there's time for during the bursts. Her energy is contagious and unending.  She took us away from the van and off on a snowmobile trail.
The Aurora just kept getting better and better so our night was not a chase. That being said, every night is a crapshoot.  You never know what will happen. Our night didn't have a great prediction; we thought we were barely going to see it and then it just went crazy! And Marketa took so many awesome photos of us, I couldn't be more thankful.  It's nice to capture my own photos, but to have someone to shoot professional photos of all of us together for a change is priceless.   
I was only able to see a very light tinge of green with my naked eyes; I mostly saw shades of white and grey.  It might be because of how bad my eyesight is, who knows, but I'm not colorblind.  It's the science behind how our eyes see in the dark. Ronn explains it. Some people claim that they can see the colors green , red and purple.  I could not.  They of course are visible in the photos because the camera picks up the colors when it's set correctly. But seeing the Aurora in white and greys was pretty exciting when it dances and covers the sky.  
I recommend renting a camera and tripod from Ronn and Marketa if you don't own one. Even if you don't shoot on a regular basis, you can do this and it'll give you something to do other than just standing around staring at the sky.   You can also take photos of the stars without city light pollution.
That being said, neither of my sons shot and they thoroughly enjoyed the experience.
When Ronn saw my lense, he told Marketa to give me a better one- mine isn't good enough for shooting night shots.  This is how much they care about giving you the whole experience.  
The night before you're scheduled you'll get an email telling you what time they'll be picking you up in the van.  It's a nice van, tall enough to stand straight up in, but with everyone dressed like Michelin men, it's close quarters with 12 passengers.  
Once everyone is picked up from their hotels, off you go! En route Ronn puts on a headset so everyone can hear and he goes over the plan for the evening. There is a big monitor that hangs in front of the passengers and you'll be able to view the "science " that is being explained as Ronn drives to your first viewing spot (and hopefully your only).  Once you arrive the photography lesson begins and everyone who is shooting makes the adjustments to their cameras.  Might be boring for non photographers, but it goes quickly. Then it's everyone out of the van as soon as they (Ronn and Marketa ) spot the Aurora.

review.author: Christian M.
review.description: One of the best experiences I could ask for when it comes to finding the Aurora Lights. Both Ronn and Marketa were super helpful with setting up the cameras, picking people up on time, and making sure every question was answered when needed. If you're ever in Fairbanks and need help with finding the Aurora Lights, I highly recommend booking with Ronn and Marketa, because it'll be a great experience!!

review.author: Karrie L.
review.description: Absolutely loved our tour and seeing muskox in close proximity and reindeers. The tour was very informative and we got to touch and hold a reindeer antler. I think this is a must stop for all animal lovers. \n\nI got many gifts from the gift shops too.

review.author: Eric B.
review.description: For me and Gayle, getting to UAF's Large Animal Research Station was half the "fun".  We were at the UAF bookstore, where Gayle indicated that it was only a 2+ mile walk.  What she didn't see was that much of it was through the woods on often wet and buggy trails.  We made it, and were very thankful to the 2 gentlemen from Toronto who gave us a ride back to our Hotel. \n\nDuring our visit, we really only saw the hind ends of 2 Musk Ox and at a distance.  We were told that seeing the Reindeer required one of their scheduled tours.  However, the gift shop (featuring Musk Ox "kisses" and their yarn related products) was cool, as were the University-associated folks running the show.

review.author: Michael G.
review.description: So glad my roomie added this to our itinerary, because it's something I would have never even thought about doing. Getting up close and personal with the muskox and reindeer was super cool and being able to learn about them from graduate students that are super passionate about their work made it that much more fun. Definitely go support this research station and drop a few bucks at their gift shop to support this awesome gem that's part of the University of Alaska.

review.author: Sharon P.
review.description:
Enjoyed a $10 tour with a guide who explained the Station's purpose for protecting and caring for reindeer, muskoxen and of all things the exotic Alaskan cow. Fun to watch the babies with their mommas and learn about how the muskox sheds his undercoat and how the wool is plucked for sweaters, hats, etc. The yarn is luxuriously soft and very expensive but absolutely worth every penny. The gift shop sells all sorts of woolen items and trinkets. 

Large viewing area, separate pens and plenty of space to walk around. Enjoy a picnic with a view of the animals (if they're not at the far end of the pasture). 

Friendly and knowledgeable guides, loads of parking and easy to find. Worth a visit to learn about the research and care for the animals. I learned that willow is the muskoxens favorite munchie, its packed with copper necessary for their diet.

review.author: Christi M.
review.description: What a fantastic tour!!!!  The musk ox are beautiful and it was so much fun to see the reindeer.  This was one of our favorite things in Fairbanks.   The tour is worth every penny and they have a great gift shop!

review.author: Tamara M.
review.description: This is an amazing place where they study Muskox and Reindeer and the effects of the environmental changes on the spies. TAKE the tour, worth the $10. Very educational and getting to see the animals up close.

review.author: Cathy B.
review.description: A terrific, easy walk in a (literally) pastoral setting. The place has restricted hours, so look ahead. I knew it would be closed when I went, but enjoyed my walk and long-distance viewing anyway.

review.author: Sasha R.
review.description: Best Time Ever. This is the NICEST place I have been to in a long time and our little family of three had a very special time.

review.author: Patty R.
review.description: Just visited this research facility of beautiful rolling hills with Muskoxen and Reindeer. Great, informative tour with Matt, cool items in the gift shop, and the most adorable Muskoxen babies! Six this year and so cute - they run down the hill to greet the tour. Facility is impeccably clean and staff care tremendously for their animal charges. A must see when in Fairbanks!

review.author: Steven S.
review.description: Learned a lot of facts about muskox, reindeer and caribou. The baby muskox were fun to watch them play. I only wish the tour involved going further back on the property to see the older herd.

review.author: Johnny C.
review.description:
The degrees here do not prepare you for joining the workforce after graduating. The courses are extremely broad and shallow, and they do not provide the skills or knowledge necessary to become competent in your field or to work in the real world. 

The administration are awful people who do NOT care about those they should be taking care of. They regularly spout talking points about equality and being good people, but their actions reveal their hypocrisy. It's truly stomach churning.

If you're the victim of a crime, the campus police do not care and will do the bare minimum that they can get away with so they can just close the case ASAP. 

The museum is a fine place to visit if you're passing through Fairbanks, but I strongly advise against attending this university.

review.author: Winny H.
review.description: This university has the Geophysical Institute which allows us to learn so much about Alaska, their animals such as seals, bears, salmon, moose, and caribou. In addition there's a museum that holds information about Aurora lights (Borealis and Australia). Also have info about history of Alaska Pipeljne how it started and how they built 800 miles. Incredible! This university also has dorms and parking is convenient. Many students eager to learn and I love that.

review.author: Krista M.
review.description:
Ahh, this review is solely for the University Bookstore. We made a quick trip up to Fairbanks from Denali National Park to hit up a major supermarket for their Western Union. I wasn't going to drive all the way to Fairbanks and back to Denali just for a Western Union. I needed to make the gas guzzling trip worth it so I did a quick search for University of Alaska Fairbanks and decided to check out the bookstore. I love books and thought I might be able to pick up some souvenirs here as well. 

Luckily, I was right! The abundance of items in this bookstore was definitely surprising! There were t-shirts, sweatshirts, notebooks, coffee cups, pint glasses, mittens, scarves, hats, yoga mats... pretty much anything you could ever need AND there was a huge sale going on, making a college bookstore affordable for once! I got two t-shirts and a sweatshirt for myself, a t-shirt for my mom, a t-shirt for my cousin, and a pint glass and it was under $100. They had North Face gloves and scarves discounted at least 40%, too. It was tempting to resist buying more but I did have to consider it was June and I had limited space in my backpack... I wish I could have bought more though!  

The University as a whole was easy to find, well-maintained, and the bookstore signage was prominent. Parking was easy although it should be noted it was June and I'm assuming a lot of students returned home for summer. Driving around the campus heading back down towards Denali was a real treat... We don't have rock climbing walls, animals, etc. on college campuses in Western New York! I hope to return to Fairbanks someday and I'll definitely stop at the University while I'm in the area!

review.author: Sasha R.
review.description: We stopped at Temperature sign which is a popular photo location daring the winter: \nWinter Highlights. If you have some free time in Fairbanks, have access to transportation and want to take a memorable photos then this is the spot to do it at. We were there at --29F/--34C. In Fairbanks this is what memories are made of, pretty much lol

review.author: Keven W.
review.description:
Been I been to this university for only the summer and I have to admit it is pretty nice. The only thing the university can not help is the mosquitoes and  they bit my head like crazy.  Anyways I was here over an internship during the summer. The campus is smaller, but spacious, but it overlooks a hill. If you go through a bike trail, you there is a pound you can go fishing, but unfortunately I went the whole week and did not catch jack down there.  Hmm they have a nice gym for the students and it was nice. The only problem is they have a weird policy about shoes, you must take them off before entering the gym even if you are warming some. But the staff was pretty rude I thought.

Anyways besides that there is no tax which was nice and every Wednesday was $1 ice cream which was cool. Anyways the food wise goes just depends on where you go. I ended up going to this cafe in the science building and getting their special which is a sandwich or spaghetti which was nice.

The campus does have a museum which I was able to visit one time. I really liked it and go to see the behind the scenes part.  But yeah I am usually not into museums much.  Anyways hmm oh yes I did live in the dorm rooms, the huge one out in front. I thought it was not too bad.  I wish I had more of my privacy however because I had a roommate. The kitchen was pretty dirty and well you had to clean the dishes in order to use them to cook.  The residents were friendly though, I made some friends though them.

I worked in the ARSC building which was cool, even though it was a 1/2 mile trek there, I had fun. Sometimes when I was lazy, I took the shuttle =) but I figured it was quicker walking.  Taking the bus was not too bad, but we had bikes so we just biked it to Fred Meyer. They did have a Sam's club, so I took the bus with my luggage and stocked up.

review.author: Alan S.
review.description: Pretty cool little campus, but nothing particularly stand out about it.  I was hoping to check out the Museum of the North, but that didn't happen.  I did get the chance to see some buildings and classrooms (wild eh?) which were pretty standard and felt like they were built in the late 70s or mid 80s.  There is a nice view of the mountains from the campus... so there is that.  Most interesting thing was seeing the co-eds sunbathing in April... it was about 54 F out.

review.author: Chris F.
review.description: UAF on yelp! I love it. It's a great place for tenure. Or ten years. Highly recommended! It's a little chilly though, at least most of the time.

review.author: Steven T.
review.description: UAF has much to offer all year round. They have a Gym, post office, theater, nice trails for skiing or walking, even frisbee golf. The Pub is a must for drinks and live performances. The Woods center has a variety of food to choose from. Radio broadcasts on campus-KUAC=I love Public Radio!

review.author: Rusty S.
review.description:
Visited the University campus during a recent vacation in Fairbanks, mostly to check out the Museum of the North.  While we were there, though, thought it would be nice to explore a bit.  

We wound up having lunch at the food court in the central commons building-- which was pretty dead on a Saturday afternoon.  Most of the shops in the food court were closed, but there the burger joint was open and their two-person team was also staffing the adjacent coffee stand.  The food here was at the low end of "blah", but that's just about exactly what we were expecting.  At least it was relatively cheap.

The commons building was pretty neat; reminded me of a big ski lodge.

review.author: Jennifer D.
review.description: Took a few classes on campus.  My Sweetie rec'd Teaching Certificate.  Awesome University!  Chased Northern lights up on top of campus in 2001 with Sweetie.

review.author: Jennifer W.
review.description: I would like to praise God for my buddies on the Sopah- Paranormal Investigation Team for investigating my fathers property and my home at 1401.3 Alaska Hwy Delta Junction, AK.  I had taken pictures on my old IPhone 5S while living with my ex husband and caught paranormal activity on camera and Mel responded just like Jesus would, she believed me.....thanks Mel....she responded like a rescue squad with her team and came to help me.  I was being tormented by some evil entity and believe after having victory through much prayer, I believe that entity may be attached to my mother, she is extremely nice an caring to others but has been abusive to me all my life really....I just kept stuffing thinking it was me....I came to Brinnion, WA to get away from my mother and brother, they were making things so difficult for me to survive.  But shortly after my mother came with my brother and I feel so tormented since she has been here....I have been busting my a_ _ helping up keep the yard almost every day I've been here and cleaning house (it was a filthy in here in my opinion).  I use to be afraid of heights (just ask my dad), but God gave me victory in that area because mom mentioned the woodshed was leaking and I did notice all the pine needles outside the upstairs window while taking a bath so I got up there and cleaned off what seemed like 1/2 foot of pine needles and branches and later I trimmed the tree that was touching the house.  I have cleaned off the deck a  few times especially after a recent storm and raked so many leaves while taking care of the yard, it looks really nice.  I told my mom she needed to get saved....she claims she does know Christ, but something is very wrong.  Yesterday she was throwing silverware in the kitchen sink (she seemed very irritated ).  I was in God's word and played God's hymns before I started my day so I was happy.  She was in the way of putting the peanut butter container away so I calmly slid the peanut butter jar across the counter when she responded out of anger and told me not to throw things, I responded I'm sorry you misunderstood I slid it across the counter I never intended to throw anything then I walked out back into the entryway to continue to play my flute-God's hymns when it seemed like the devil came out of her....she said may I remind you who's house this is....I said I know it is your house and I don't want your house or your money she became more angry when I quoted scripture.... she kicked me out during a storm, I rode my bike over 5 miles one way in much pain from being ill to use the harbor telephone to call my niece Kyla Deisler for help but she said she had not money for gas to come and get me and informed me to call her mother and I responded I refused to ask help from my sister while she lives at a drug house. I found a soft mossy place in the storm...in the National Forest and cried out to God for victory in Jesus and laid down to rest a bit and prayed...My son hasn't kept his word to me for the basic necessities to survive. I returned to my mothers soaked I got a drink from the hose and sat in a chair on the deck while my mother ate pop corn and was laughing while watching a movie...while I was in the entryway Satan decided to offer me a bath, I said no a bed is all I need.  I said I only need a bed and within her seemed to offer me back in to I don't want her bike-it is extremely painful for me to use it anymore)  I'm praying someone scores when it's found.  They haven't helped since, it's been some time and I have been struggling...but my son's too busy for his mother who busted her but raising him...who is this kid?????  And who are these so called co-worker-supervisor who says my son and Primo Seniza told him everything about me ( my son has chose not to be a part of my life when he left Alaska, I rarely heard from him unless I called him....no concern at all for me as his mom.  I pray God makes my son a job offer he can't refuse that he would love and helps him choose better friends or realizes who his true friends in Alaska are. This is definitely not the son I raised, my son used to always put mom first I loved his hugs)something is very wrong.  They pretty much left it at that and I haven't seen either one (and she never got up in the middle of the night to discuss with me why I was up-I was sick in pain hurting and praying....but she possible judged me the wrong way as well by believing gossip from others in Mason County.  Anthony said he would help me me with a new cell like he said and with finding me wheels.  I understand people have lives and jobs but I know now this isn't my family at all...Mountain Movers is and that's where I choose to spend my every Sunday-I am happy in Jesus there, my family is at Mountain Movers Church not here. help his mother with medical attention for a broken wrist. Thanks for all you do Sopah..God does use even the gift of paranormal experts for His honor and glory.  Thank you Jesus for blessing me with Mel

review.author: Jacob G.
review.description:
UAF is a great college especially for alaska. It has been my goal to attend it since my freshman year of high school, and now I'm a freshman at college at UAF. People always ask me why I "settle" for UAF as my college and why I didn't apply anywhere else. I tell them that it has is amazing if you want to study sciences, the tuition is great because I'm an alaskan resident, and its a billion times better than UAA. 
 I very much enjoy the layout of the university's campus as well. I am a resident of Moore Hall and all of my classes are extremely accessible from my dorm. The dorm is self is kinda so-so, but its old so whatever. I am extremely satisfied with my living quarters, of course its small, but I didn't expect otherwise, its a freshman dorm. I did not expect to be living in a palace. 
 The classes and teachers are amazing as well. I don't have a single class that I am taking where I do not like my teacher or how the class is taught. They are all difficult enough to keep me intrigued, but aren't too difficult for me to just say F*** it and give up. 
 The main complaint I get from people is that it is too cold in fairbanks. My response to those people is to buy a warm jacket and quit their bitching. Pardon my vulgarity. Of course it's cold, its Alaska. If you want to be warm go somewhere else. My only complaint is that the hill down to the commons gets extremely icy so its difficult to walk down. But I plan on buying a sled soon, so my complaint will be obsolete. 
 The food at the Tilly (the commons), is...... well dorm food. So I don't expect much from it. Though occasionally, there is pretty decent food. A few times they have had roast beef which they carve, and my favorite dish was the pasta that they made a few weeks back. But hands down, UNLIMITED SOFT SERVE ICE CREAM FTW! (when the machine works). I very much enjoy ordering the "420" which is a quesadilla, with a double bacon cheese burger, chicken pieces, grilled onions, and pretty much what ever else you want in it. You can order it at the grill. It's pretty freaking delicious. but you have to be hungry. I recommend when there is mac and cheese, to open it up and put some mac and cheese in it. I also once put gravy on it, MIND BLOWN! it was delicious, I'm pretty sure I ate two of them. Which is a lot because they are quite big. 
 Overall I am a fan of UAF, it is a great college and I'm getting a lot out of it, and I hope to leave fully educated in which ever field I chose to be in, which at the moment is geology, which is very interesting and especially being in Alaska where the Geology is ridiculous, it is a great major to look into.

review.author: Wilfred C.
review.description: Despite the bad things Ive heard about UAF, from the terrible parking system to the teachers to the gross campus cafeteria, I would say that this university offers a great education with helpful staff and great programs. The new student office is easy to get through with the help desk as the entrance. The lines are small and the employees work fast. The campus has a lot of food options outside of the cafeteria. There is a taco bell, which offers almost all of the same products as the off campus ones. They have a pizza place, a coffee place, and a sushi booth all in the upstairs of the wood center! The wood center also has pool, foosball, arcade games, bowling, and TVs to watch. Its also the center for all kinds of events, from video game tournaments to monday night football and job fairs. The campus bus system is very helpful, especially once it starts getting cold out. There is a bus that goes up and down 1 street, and it brings you from parking to the center of campus. It sure beats walking, and the wait is short. \n\nThe teachers are wonderful. Of the 5 teachers ive experienced, they have all been funny, helpful, and very good at involving their students and teaching the information they test you on. The dorms are also a breath of fresh air. There is a convenience store on the bottom floor, along with a subway. The subway offers reduced price 6 inch sandwiches, which is great to grab before you head up to your dorm.  The library is much better than I had thought when I first walked in. There is a coffee stand in a room near the front, and there are tons of floors to study on. Its easy to get away from any disturbances by heading to a different floor. There are computers for everyone to use, and printers ready to use. The chairs are comfy and the front desk is very helpful. If uaf is your best option for schooling, dont be discouraged by the rumors.

review.author: Dwain C.
review.description: I went to the Skagway School District in Skagway, Alaska on 8/15/2014.  I was hoping to buy a school shirt or cap.  I was able to get a Skagway Panthers hoodie.  Friendly staff.

name: Alaska Academy of Advanced Cosmetology & Massage Institute

review.author: John D.
review.description: Can't get ahold of them. Their email bounces back, the phone number on their website sounds like it's off the hook, they don't respond to Facebook messages.

name: Juneau City & Borough of School District Community School

review.author: Big M.
review.description: Adequate weight and cardio equipment. There is a rock wall that isn't very big but still fun and the locker rooms are in very good shape and clean. I just wish they had more weight equipment but that would be impossible because their weight room is so small.

name: University of Arkansas South-West Resrch & Ext Ctr

review.author: Stacey G.
review.description: The folk know southern Arkansas Agriculture.  There are not any folks that do it better.

review.author: Amy S.
review.description: Not a clean environment for the children, there are mice in the building. The owner Vicki knows this, and still has not reported the issue. I know this firsthand, also the "teachers" love to take a nap with the children. I'm sorry, but when is it ever ok to nap when the kids are? Who is responsible when they get up and there is not an adult to watch them? I would not recommend the school to anyone.

review.author: Selena P.
review.description: I love this school.... Hands on training day #1... Individual instruction as needed... Caring, fun, and understanding staff and student body...

name: Kumon Math and Reading Center of Little Rock - West

review.author: Rona H.
review.description: Our little son loves math, and we're lucky we've discovered this place. They help to develop our son's talent, and it's good that we have programs like this for little kids to keep them busy! Definitely 5 stars!

review.author: Ruth S.
review.description: Kumon's personalized learning  has helped our daughter.  She has received a customized plan that has helped her master each   proficiency level based on her needs.

review.author: Sharon J.
review.description: My oldest started at Kumon a few months before starting Kindergarten. I was amazed at the progress he made in a few short months. Since then, all three of my boys have attended Kumon. What really stuck out to me was how much Ms. Das was invested in my boys. Her ability to identify my sons' strengths and weaknesses was an integral part of their progress. The team of educators that she has is very good and they have remained consistent throughout. In the 6 years that I have been there, I have seen little to no staffing changes, which is very beneficial to a child's progress. I highly recommend Kumon-West Little Rock to anyone considering it. Thank you Kumon for everything that you have done for my three boys!!

name: Paul Mitchell The School - Little Rock

review.author: Benjamin B.
review.description: When I lived in the area, I patronized this school regularly.  I was generally happy with the service that I received.

review.author: Amy P.
review.description:
Love this place
Great school happy faces
Need to fix their open and closed online
It says your open on Saturday and I've had many appointments on Saturday 
But it seems they are closed on Saturday now

Very disappointing 
Please rethink this as many of us can not do week day appointments

review.author: Stacy D.
review.description: I had a great time at my appointment with Khadijah. She did exactly what I wanted with my natural hair. I'm trying to get health and length to my hair.

review.author: Mary L.
review.description: I try to be as positive as possible but if you are looking at schools look at salon professional. This school has tore my spirit up due to unprofessional friendships between staff and students which in turn cause you to not have clients like the friend of welcome desk. The education is sub part and 98% of the time we don't even get to use real product. All that I find valuable in the school is the name. There are a few shining jewels of teachers but they have slowly started firing the ones who actually cared about the students once we got the newest director who has family on the staff

review.author: Tiffany W.
review.description: My Memaw wanted to come here to get a hair cut. We could not be more happy with this place!! Everyone is super friendly. We brought a photo in and the lady cut it just the way she wanted it done. I could not believe she got a great hair cut for only $10.00. That's a total steal!! I seen a lady getting her hair dyed BLUE so they even have ALL colors of hair dye which is totally awesome. Definitely stop by and see what they are about. They will take good care of you

review.author: Brooklin C.
review.description: I love getting my hair done here \nGreat service and very friendly people! Love my new hair and can't wait to come back! thanks Hannah!

review.author: Minh P.
review.description: I'm a fan of this place.  Be prepared for your haircuts to take a lot longer since they have students cutting your hair.  They have instructor stylists roaming each station to monitor each student.  I did not feel like my hair was going to get jacked.  I got two shampoos in addition to the haircut, one before and one after.  \n\nThe icing on the cake is that military gets free haircut.  Be prepared to tip your stylist well with cash if you are military.  They don't allow you to use your card to tip the stylists.

review.author: Elecia H.
review.description: WOW!!  This is the BEST Beauty School in Arkansas!!  I have only great things to say!  Great pricing for services and the staff is very professional.  LOVE IT!

review.author: Cheyenne M.
review.description: What a place! Everyone rules! So does Andrea! So does Nicole! I love this place! AHHHHHH!!!!!!!

review.author: Angie S.
review.description: First time visiting PM School. The staff/students were friendly, but not professional at all. So much gossiping, joking around, singing and basically I felt like I was just one of those mannequin heads they practice on. Seems like the students should be taught when you make a mistake you don't announce it for all to hear but instead go find your instructor and quietly tell them what you did wrong. It doesn't make the customer feel confident about the service they are receiving. The young lady that first introduced herself to me was very sweet but really unsure of herself which is understandable. There were two students working on coloring my hair and neither had a clue as to what they were doing. The instructor left them to their own devices and when she did come back she had to take over because the bleach had been on for quite a while and she had to correct their mistakes. I don't really blame the students because they didn't really seem to have a lot of instruction. It took over four hours for them to do my hair and since they were closing they didn't get to the cut. The color didn't achieve what was intended but I didn't really expect it to. But I am pleased with the results. The instructor seems to know her stuff and ended up doing the majority of my color. I would say the main thing I was disappointed in was the lack of professionalism.

review.author: T W.
review.description: I used to like coming here, but I am very disappointed with the service received when trying to make an appointment. Basically the young lady who answered the phone says you can just come in and find out, there may or may not be someone who can perform your services. I am not going to waste a trip for a maybe. I understand systems may be down, but to tell me you're in the back and can not see who is on the floor does not help at all. I would not have minded to be placed on hold while she checked. It would be so much easier for her to go find out then for me to make a trip only to be turned away. The guest is not at fault because the system is down and should not be punished. Good guest services is very important and I did not receive that. I contacted the school to report what took place and was told that the Sales Leader would contact me. That never happened, places that don't value customers do not get repeat business. Haven't been back since.

review.author: Dawn H.
review.description: Went in here to get my hair done before heading out of town and all I can say is WOW !! The girl who done my hair was VERY talented. (She was a level 2 student) Wish I could remember her name but she was from Belize. Also loved the atmosphere of the salon. I will be back the next time I am in Little Rock.

review.author: Emily I.
review.description: I have been going here for years. They have the best students and best hairdressers around. The color is always perfect and my haircut is always how I imagined it to be. I highly recommend going here. Five stars!

review.author: Stacey M.
review.description: Living in NWA, I dreaded the drive down for class. So glad I made the trip. Danny knows real estate inside and out. He has, and continues, to practice. He has been involved on the back end of real estate with committees, and he knows best practices. I did a post-broker class and loved to be able to pick his brain of knowledge and came home with a notebook full of material. Thanks so much!!

review.author: David L.
review.description: I took my 18 hour post-licensure class with Tom Rhoads.  I highly enjoyed her class.  She was very knowledgeable and gave us more than what was just in the textbooks.  There wasn't a question that we asked that she didn't have an answer to.  I learned more about real estate in 18 hours than I did in my entire online real estate class.  When I take my next class I will definitely take it with Tom Rhoads.

review.author: Marsha F.
review.description: My granddaughter just finished Thompson's driving school. Best money we've ever spent. She passed her state written exam on the first try. The driving instructors are so good & patient & made her feel very comfortable & confident driving. Right after she finished her driving skills lessons we scheduled her state driving skills test. She passed it with confidence. Got her REAL federal ID license immediately. I would highly recommend Thompson's driving school to anyone who has a beginner driver. They were awesome. I could go on & on. So thankful we made this investment in our child's driving future. Thanks Thompson's Driving School!!!

review.author: Mrs A.
review.description: took my son driving lessons at this school for beginners and this is the best school for beginners learning how to drive. They really make your child feel comfortable and have confidence learning to drive. The owner Niki is awesome and the trainers Christopher and Patricia are awesome teachers. I'm so glad I made the right choice taking my son to this school right after he got his driving permit now he will definitely know how important  safety is while driving ...

review.author: Rona H.
review.description: We visited campus on the open day, and a couple of weeks ago, we sent our son there to study! The whole welcome week was well organized, and senior students were helping around the campus, which was lovely. Hopefully, we made the right choice by picking this place!

review.author: Juliet H.
review.description: Hubby's alma mater. Strikes me as a small university with a big college spirit! Well manicured campus, great sports facilities, and friendly faculty and staff! UCA is able to fill a pretty tall order even though it's "fun size!"

review.author: Ty A.
review.description: As this is the college my daughter is thinking of attending, I made note to take special observation of the campus.  I was very pleased with UCA.  Albeit, a smaller campus, it's laid out very well and the grounds are immaculate!  Walking through, the buildings, I was relieved to know that my daughter was going to not just get a good education, but be in a safe place.  I feel I can trust this university with the care and education of my little girl.

review.author: DC S.
review.description: I have attended and even worked at UCA in my past and must say it's just a great school. Beautiful clean campus and good professors made my years there a pleasure.

review.author: John F.
review.description:
UCA has a lot of potential and my experience has been decent. The school can be much better than it is if they just played to their strengths. While UCA has very strong and well-rounded Chemistry and Physics departments (some of the best in the state, in my opinion), they tend to focus their interests in Football and Business. While this is their main constituency in numbers, I feel that this is a fatal move that can keep this school focusing on the less relevant features of a top-notch school. The recent donation to the Lewis Science Center from Conway Corp and the recent large acquisitions of research funding by the departments should stand as an extreme message to Tom Courtway that the real substance of a successful school is in its academia and not its sports. This is why UCA receives 4 out of 5 from me. 

There's a lot of potential for this school in the sciences. The science departments have top-notch professors that are sending students off to graduate school at places like Harvard, Cornell, Georgia-Tech, Penn State and other high quality graduate schools. It just feels like no one is noticing the extreme achievements of these professors and missing a grand opportunity to capitalize on UCA's true strengths. Get with it, Mr. Courtway. You have an excellent opportunity with these professors. A great school is built off of strong science and academia, not sports. This is where UCA should be sinking its money.

But, as I am graduating soon, I appreciate the opportunities afforded to me at this university. UCA has provided a decent experience for me and allowed me to expand into new territories of my life that were previously unreachable. Thank you!

review.author: Christina B.
review.description: Lots of options for your education. Most of the teachers and staff are great when it comes to helping you. The education program is amazing. Lots of well prepared teachers working together.

review.author: Stefany M.
review.description: Its a good school for the money. It has flaws, but what school doesn't? Im a senior and am graduating in August, I enjoyed my time here.

review.author: Marilyn P.
review.description: Excellent college with a broad selection of courses. Faculty is highly qualified and student friendly.

review.author: mitch m.
review.description: Good strong school with a public school price. Average ACT scores are almost as high as Fayetteville.

review.author: David M.
review.description: Excellent teachers. I've had 3 kids graduate from there and working on a 4th. Go purple Panthers!!!

review.author: David M.
review.description: Great little college campus right on the river. Very friendly place to go to school.

review.author: Lois B.
review.description: We'd heard of MARC from fellow aviators, so arranged to stop by (via road - not wings) while on vacation.  The receptionist was very generous with her time and cheerfully gave us a tour during which she explained the history and current objectives of MARC.  She introduced us to team members as we walked thru the various areas.  Staff and volunteers were all very friendly and happy to answer our questions.

review.author: Mariah L.
review.description:
Acting as the local DMV, but don't carry any of the mandatory forms required....  They don't tell you that you are supposed to bring them in pre-filled either. Do they not have a printer at this building?

You are magically supposed to know this. 

Staff are frantic, overwhelmed, and unknowledgeable. I was put on hold for very simple questions, six times, and just having them verify my appt time was embarrassingly cumbersome for them. 

They are unequipped to prepare this service to the community, and I feel bad for everyone involved.

review.author: Margaret N.
review.description: What a wonderful shop! It's better than most fabric stores I visit both in Anchorage and out of state. Owner is very knowledgeable. She's even created a kuspuk pattern you can buy at the store. There's tons of different options for notions, fabrics and that elusive serger thread. Best of all, she carries a full line of Bernina sewing machines and supplies. My favorite! If you have a spare hour, or three, be sure to visit. If you are a sewist you will love this place!

review.author: S. Lynn W.
review.description: Customer service is non existent. This is the second time I've gone in this store, a year apart,  without being acknowledged until I was leaving! I typically buy something from any shop I walk into, did the first time here too, but never again. I've categorized this one as a "don't go unless you 'look' like a quilter".

review.author: Marcia M.
review.description:
A great shop!  I've taken a couple of classes from Jodi, the owner.  she came to our small town of Tenakee and taught a group of us how to make kuspuks from her pattern.  She even brought out fabric choices for some of the class participants.  She is a very skilled and patient instructor. We had fun learning and came out of the class with beautiful garments. I've also taken a by Annie bag making class with Jodi. I had already made a couple of the bags on my own, but it was great to get some tips and tools from Jodi that made the process even easier and more enjoyable.
I do not live in Juneau, so I buy most of my Raintree fabrics online.  Jodi's website is very easy to use.  If you do have questions, you can call the shop and get them answered by a helpful, knowledgeable person.  I think every time I have placed an online order it gets mailed to me that day.
I always try to stop by the shop in person when I do get to town.  It is a very fun place to visit.  So many lovely fabrics, patterns and project ideas.  
I have also bought two sewing machines from the shop.  Both of the machines were trade-ins that were like new. I have sewn many projects using these machines and have never had a problem with them.

review.author: Amy K.
review.description: This is my happy place. With the new owner Jodi Buck running the shop, you will not want to ever leave the place.\nShe is so warm and welcoming.   Great classes for all abilities with wonderful, knowledgeable staff ( Edith, Bonnie,  Lana ) who will help you with all aspects from suggesting fabrics to helping with color combinations and superb knowledge for troubleshooting faulty machines ( Amy) \nOpen sew Thursday and Friday.... just bring your machine and tools and you will make great progress with lots of supportive folks sewing right beside you.

review.author: Kathryn G.
review.description: Friendly, knowledgeable staff.  Wide variety of classes for all skill levels. Great instructors!  Every time I visit the shop there is something new that catches the eye.  Fabrics, trims, patterns, quilts and samples for upcoming classes.  Inspiration abounds!

review.author: Pearl C.
review.description:
I was looking for someone to photograph my family during our cruise. No luck! Then I came across Peter of Juneau Photo Tours and I struck GOLD! From our first email of just asking if he knew any photographers, Peter was so kind to step up to the plate. He told me he had a great idea for a photo shoot and he would pick us up from the docks.

I am still in awe that Peter knew exactly what I was looking for... cinematic location that focuses on the beauty of Alaska. Nailed it! He also toured us to the non-touristy area of Mendenhall so we could enjoy the glacier without the crowds, taught us all he knew about the salmon fish hatchery & even fed us freshly caught smoked salmon.

Peter and his wife Alicia are bar none the highlight of our Juneau visit. Don't miss out on this one of a kind experience!

review.author: Becky M.
review.description:
Peter is everything you want in a guide - and more! Before the trip, he took the time to help us carefully consider different options thoroughly and patiently answered all of our questions. He knows everything about photography, glaciers, and Juneau and will make sure you are ready for your adventure - no matter what your experience level is.

During the trip, he and Josh showed us how to rappel into ice caves, taught us how to take photos like Peter's award-winning work, and even climb back up with ice axes. Peter and his wife were generous enough to bring lunch & homemade snacks that gave us the energy to spend 8 hours trekking across the glacier.

What I didn't know was that he had been working with my now-fiancé to plan a surprise proposal for the last 30 mins of the glacier trek... And it was perfect. Not only did he find a stunning ice cave and help us take incredible pictures, but he and his wife made us feel so loved by paying attention to details like bringing little champagne bottles to celebrate!

Thank you Peter, Alicia and Josh for your kindness, guidance, and friendship. Highly recommend booking a tour with these amazing folks for an unforgettable experience!

review.author: Maggie L.
review.description:
We had a great day with Peter recently!  My husband and I spent the day hiking with Peter up to a glacier (and an ice cave)! Peter taught me so much that I didn't know about my camera and photography.  My husband isn't overly interested in photography and had a great time tagging along for the epic hike.

We communicated with Peter in the weeks leading up to our trip and he truly customized our day based on what we were looking for and interested in.

He is a super interesting, talented and just a great guy to spend the day with. He grew up in Juneau and was passionate about sharing it with people.

review.author: Mark H.
review.description: Peter is the WHOLE package! If you want to know the Juneau area, take incredible pictures and have an epic adventure, then Peter is the person you are looking for. We had an awesome time adventuring and taking pictures with Peter. He made us feel like we were adventuring and learning with a friend. Peter is knowledgeable and helpful. He went out of his way to make us feel at home in Juneau, including drying wet hiking boots! While I have a strong understanding of photography, I learned an incredible amount from Peter, who also took the time to help with some photo editing. My wife, who is a beginner photographer, also learned a great deal from Peter, who was extremely patient. She learned how to set up her camera, how to feel more confident with some of the technical aspects of the camera, and how to create artistic composition. Peter is excellent with photographers and adventurers of all levels. We walked away from our adventure with some outstanding photos to document our adventure, as well as a new friend. \n\nThank you Peter, for your guidance and hospitality. The next time we are in Juneau, we plan to book another adventure. We highly recommend booking a photography adventure with Peter.

review.author: Big M.
review.description: Adequate weight and cardio equipment. There is a rock wall that isn't very big but still fun and the locker rooms are in very good shape and clean. I just wish they had more weight equipment but that would be impossible because their weight room is so small.

review.author: Mary Lee V.
review.description: Lovely, well-stocked Yarn Store. Located Downtown by Creek Street behind Parnassus Books. Great selection of locally hand dyed and commercial dyed yarns, knitting and crochet accessories, as well as some quilting supplies. Very helpful staff. I had a hard tome not going too crazy, but couldn't resist a skein of very beautiful soft merino in a soft brown color. Easy to find and just a short walk from the cruise dock. Highly recommended!

name: University of Alaska Southeast Ketchikan Campus

review.author: Aimee S.
review.description: Our three year old daughter has been attending CHP since September and it has been a truly magical experience. Everyday she is excited to go to school to see her teachers and friends and always comes home with stories of a fun project they worked on. She has thrived in such a loving and creative environment. \n\nThe thoughtful safety protocols put in place due to Covid kept the school open the whole year which was impressive.

review.author: Jed M.
review.description: My daughter has been in the 3s program this year and absolutely loves it. This was her first year in a group program and she adapted immediately thanks to the wonderful staff. She loves her teacher and the friends she's made, and looks forward to seeing them every day... and that's saying a lot since it can be tough for her to open up to new people. Highly recommend CHP!

review.author: Lauren G.
review.description:
We first fell in love with Cobble Hill Playschool when we saw how our niece thrived during her time in the 3s and 4s program. Now we have been able to experience all the makes CHP so special first hand. Our older daughter spent 2 years at CHP and is now thriving in Kindergarten as she has entered so prepared. Our younger daughter is in her second year and in the 3s program with her cousin and both are having the same amazing experience. 

We have been so happy to see the incredibly supportive, nurturing, creative and engaging experience that CHP creates. The teachers and the school leadership are so invested and committed to the kids. We feel thankful knowing our girls are in such good hands each day at drop-off. 

The classroom is such a wonderful place for the children to explore. It is organized into different centers and the children have time to explore on their own as well as with more structured enrichment. It really gives the children time to engage with different areas of learning on their own, with their peers and with the teachers. The ratio of teachers to students is small so there is always support and supervision but the kids also have a great sense of autonomy.

Our oldest daughter grew so much (academically, socially and artistically) in her first year and could not wait to return. She loved her time in the 4s program and loved being a big kid in the open classroom. Now our youngest has fallen in love with CHP. She used to cry on days she was not scheduled to attend and is so happy to be going 5 days a week this year. Our family feels so fortunate to have found CHP.

review.author: Benjamin S.
review.description: I recently completed the CLA 16 hour crash course. I had a great experience with Rebecca as my teacher. The class was structured in a way that I could quickly feel that I was learning how to talk about different things. Each week, we reviewed the previous and then moved into the new topic. Each class was very interactive which enabled me to learn more in a couple of hours (along with a bit of studying between) than I ever could have alone, because I had to focus quite intently on learning/practicing during each session. I definitely would recommend.

review.author: Ronak S.
review.description: Let me start by saying I took the CLA 16 class - this is exactly what it advertises - a crash course.
