You cover a TON of material in 4-hour sessions over a 4 week period - and at the end, you won't be fluent, but you'll have a strong working knowledge of mandarin, be able to have basic conversations, and have some ability to read and write in Mandarin - but be ready to commit to the class, and be ready to spend some time (30-60 minutes a day) studying and doing the homework.\n\nAll of that said, I loved my experience. The course does immerse you quickly, and our instructor, Rebecca, was energetic, smart, and a great at explaining material, helping us practice, providing constructive feedback, and most importantly, patient as we stumbled through pronunciation and vocabulary.

review.author: Amber L.
review.description:
I took the introductory "Crash Course" in Mandarin, taught by Ysabella Chen, at CLA. It's exactly what it claims -- a feverishly intense 16 hours of cramming Mandarin into your brain. Ms Chen is a native speaker and a gifted teacher with a passion for the language and culture of China. That passion, along with her patience and lighthearted sense of humor, really helped keep the class going during the 4-hour sessions. 

This is not a lightweight course. There is a good deal of homework, which I found very helpful to reinforce what I had learned. In addition, you will need to do a lot of studying between classes to review, and commit to memory, what you learned in the previous week's 4-hour class. If you do that, you should finish the course with a skeletal understanding of basic Chinese pronunciation, grammar, and vocabulary for various common, simple sentences, giving you a basis to build upon with further study.

It's apparent that the mission of the teacher, and the school, goes beyond just making a buck. They truly want to share their language with the world. If you're looking for any kind of Chinese instruction in NYC, try this friendly, caring, and effective school first.

review.author: Mix R.
review.description: I took Chinese class with teacher Rebecca. It was great class. She is very nice and have great skill for teaching Chinese.

review.author: Ariel K.
review.description:
CLA 16 with Teacher Rebecca was amazing! I learned so much because the class was a perfect balance between disciplined, informative, structured material (weekly homework, textbook, vocab, character writing exercises) and fun, cultural, contextual material (Chinese songs, finding personal examples, applying what we learned).

The class moves fast (which is exactly what I expected, given that it's branded as a "crash course") and is a great introduction for those who want to test out Mandarin before committing to a full semester. The class size was small, which allowed for questions and interactions.

Lastly, just like with any other languages, you get what you put into it :)

review.author: Hannah T.
review.description: Highly recommend taking the CLA 16 course if you want to start learning Mandarin. I wanted to learn because of my husband and also found that it would be useful to learn Mandarin so I can relate with Chinese speaking patients and clients in my profession. Dont be intimidated as I was at first with the idea that many topics will be covered in just a few weeks. The format and their teaching style is so effective and engaging. They taught us the foundations during this course that made a difference and helped me understand the words I am learning, be able to read/pronounce pinyin, put sentences together as compared to before taking this class, I was just memorizing words I find online but not understanding. I am so happy they accommodated to the current global situation and offered this course online and kept it as engaging as it would be in person. I had Rebecca for CLA16 and just ended the Elementary B with Chelsea, they are amazing! I'm encouraged to continue and learn more on the next level because my husband can see my improvement from memorizing a few words I didnt really understand before taking these classes to being able to have simple exchanges in Mandarin and knowing how to read and understand the context in Pinyin.

review.author: Josie J.
review.description: I highly recommend the CLA 16 hour crash course and Rebecca (our super king!) as an instructor. Rebecca is a great teacher and works hard to keep the class interactive, which can be especially tough on the weekend track of this class as it is four hours on a single day each weekend. As kind and funny as she is though, make no mistake: she's a strict teacher, and she ensures you learn the material and practice speaking as pronunciation is integral to communicating in Mandarin. Vocal inflection changes the meaning of the word you use so she appropriately spent a lot of time correcting our pronunciation and teaching us to hear hers. \n\nWhat I didn't expect, but was excited to discover, was that Rebecca incorporated Chinese history and culture into the class as she taught us the language. I took the class out of intellectual curiosity but there were many in the class who got enough out of it for business purposes, personal travel, etc.

review.author: James S.
review.description: Really enjoyed the CLA 16 Hour Crash course.  The course itself is relatively intense, with four 4 hour sessions spread over a month, with an hour or so of homework each week.  The course was a great introduction to Mandarin. Our instructor Rebecca was a fantastic instructor, keeping our small class engaged and challenged.  The classes were very interactive and fun, as well as reasonably priced.  I had to miss a class and Rebecca was very flexible in organizing a make up class.  I really enjoyed my overall experience and plan to continue my Mandarin education with CLA in the future...

review.author: Katie R.
review.description: I decided to take CLA's introductory Mandarin language course for two reasons; 1) my boyfriend's family is from Taiwan- they speak very little English and 2) I want to be prepared for whatever goes down with this trade war our lovely President has started. I chose CLA's class over similar programs because to the Yelp reviews as well as the price (believe tuition was at a discount for the month of December) and I am so glad I did! \nClass size was small (5) allowing ample time for each student to interact with the teacher and each other and the other students were all motivated to be there for their own reason. Our teacher Rebecca was excellent- she made learning a very intimidating language approachable. A lot of time was spent laughing and learning. She did an especially good job working with us on our pronunciation which is key to Mandarin as a tonal language. \nWhile faster paced, the work in this class was not overwhelming. I was able to manage a full-time job with the homework and practice. It is a good foundation for those wanting a taste of Mandarin before delving deeper. The class focuses fairly equally on speaking and writing (simplified). Results-wise CLA works; my boyfriend was amazed that he could actually understand what I was saying!

review.author: Dan J.
review.description: Truly such an amazing experience! Ysabella and her team are such talented and dedicated teachers. Learning Chinese with CLA was so motivating and results were immediately apparent. They really dig into the root and meaning of the language in such an efficient way; no unnecessary clutter and time wasting. But they always keep it engaging and fun! The teachers really understand how to guide your learning and dedicated themselves fully to us. I took the 1 month starter course and already I am writing and speaking paragraphs! This is my first Asian language! In just 4 classes! I really can not recommend this program enough. I was always encouraged and they really clicked into my personal way of learning, even in a group class. If you have any serious desire to learn Chinese in any capacity, really, this program is the best option out there.

review.author: T M.
review.description:
I've just finished the "CLA 16 hr Mandarin Crash Course".
I have to say it wasn't easy, but thanks to our dedicated instructors, Ysabella and Rebecca I somehow managed to learn the very basics of Mandarine Chinese. They really emphasize the importance of pinyin and tones, which I was lacking.( I self-taught Chinese a few times and never successful, now I know why)
Last week I happened to be in Chinatown and a few chinese girls asked me a question... surprisingly I UNDERSTOOD what they said!!
I'm very thankful for Rebecca's dedication, patience and encouragement.
The class definitely exceeded my expectation. 謝謝！

review.author: Christine P.
review.description:
Truly as good as it gets! I completed the 16 hour beginners intensive program last week and I must say the outcome exceeded my expectations..
About a year ago - being bored to death at my then job - I took my first steps with mandarin on my own. Thank God I soon changed job, so no time for mandarin. A couple months later I took classes for a month which I'd say were pretty much disappointing: the teacher hardly spoke english, there was to system or organization, so I damped the dream of mandarin..
However, last month - thank God - I decided to give it a shot with CLA. Bingo! For the first time I started feeling I understand the framework of this very different language. The teacher, Wangqi, is amazing: organized, supporting and incredibly responsible and serious on her mission: if it was solely up to her we would never take breaks ;-)
The academic material is very well selected and diverse (listening, writing, playing, songs, good books, smart additional material, video recommendation), the size of the groups ensures everyone has enough time to participate and work on the language and I loved the follow up emails after each session!
I definitely didn't expect after 4 session to be in the position to conduct basic dialogues, to recognize - even write certain characters - and actually be past my 4 tones initial terror.
I highly recommend CLA and I sincerely congratulate them.
Of course I'll start the next course in a week ;-)

review.author: Andrew C.
review.description: I took the CLA 16 Crash Course with Rebecca and it was fantastic! It really sped up my learning. You get detailed explanations for the little pieces of word and characters which makes remembering them much easier. You also get analysis of grammar rules which free apps don't give you with the same depth. The homework is also great for continuing to learn at home. I wish there was more of it. The most outstanding part of the course is the personalized help over email. Outside of class, I can send questions and get helpful answers over email which is very convenient. Overall it is very worth the money. I'll definitely be signing up for the more advanced courses!

review.author: Kenneth K.
review.description:
We're big fans of Shining Smiles! Our neighbor referred us after sending their daughter there for the past couple of years. My wife and I were putting our son into daycare at 3 months and were VERY anxious about it. Our first week we did a slow entry, a couple of hours days one, three hours day two, etc. and it was SO helpful as we acclimated emotionally and logistically. 

Prior to selecting Shining Smiles, we took a tour and met with Director Katherine. We went through their entire curricula, discussed COVID protocols, and really got a feel for their approach to early childhood education. 

Our son has now been at Shining Smiles since November 2021 and we couldn't be happier. We receive regular communication about feeding, diaper changes, and pictures during story time and other activities via the ProCare app. You think to yourself, why would I care/want to track feedings, etc. But you do, you really do. Our son's teachers clearly have bonded with him and he with them, there's such a connection that when we do pick up he's generally all smiles and laughing as we say goodbye for the day. 

Trusting who looks after your child for 8 to 9 hours a day is not easy, but when you find a place like Shining Smiles it really puts your mind at ease.

review.author: Angela C.
review.description: It has been amazing to have our 18 month old son at Shining Smiles for the last year. He goes 5 days a week and it is so clear that he feels happy and secure there because of the great teachers. They are warm and caring and have really encouraged him to develop and grow. It's been incredible to see how much he's learned in such a short amount of time and he has really come out of his shell. They do a ton of activities with all the kids, including music lessons, water and sensory play, and learning about colors, numbers, letters, etc. They are also wonderful about communicating with parents. \n\nI can't recommend Shining Smiles enough.

review.author: Jia T.
review.description: Our daughter has been at Shining Smiles for the last seven months, since she was a little over a year old, and we have been so happy and thankful with this facility and everyone who works there. Shining Smiles is more flexible than other daycares in the area tend to be (we started bb at two days/week, and now she's at four days/week), and the teachers are capable, kind, loving, and dedicated. Miss Sylvia and Miss Naomi were so patient with our daughter taking a pretty long time to adjust to the daycare nap scheduling when she first got there (also Miss Naomi is still the only adult who my daughter is willing to say "love you" back to lol), and Miss Sandy and Miss Catina have taken amazing care of her now that she's moved up to an older room (they even weaned her off her pacifier, which we would absolutely not have been able to do as smoothly on our own). Our daughter is often at Shining Smiles for pretty long days, often 8 to 5:30, and when we come to get her she is happy and so well taken care of. \n\nI've recommended Shining Smiles to many friends, and am leaving this review because the daycare hunt in Brooklyn can be so nuts. Aside from the way they care for our daughter, we really appreciate that she's in a diverse group of kids, that the facility is set up to accommodate parents who work long hours and/or who need to return to work soon after birth, that it's one of the more affordable options in the area, that it's pretty no-nonsense in many respects (no flowery learning philosophies for babies who just need to have a good time hanging out), and that they will do cloth diapers for your baby if you do them at home!

review.author: Diana E.
review.description: My 3 year old attended Shining Smiles and had such an amazing experience. She has learned so much, I love that they added science to their curriculum which allowed kids to do mini experiments. The staff really care about the kids and it shows, people who didn't teach my child knew who she was by name. Love their app that allows you to know what's happening with your child all day, they even send pictures. Definitely recommend this place!

review.author: Kathy L.
review.description: My now 18 month old has been attending Shining Smiles downtown location since 3 months old. In the past 2 months, he's spent a few days a week at their new Clinton Hill location and we love it so much that we'll be switching him full time in the next few months. The facility is bright and beautiful. The teachers are warm and caring and my son truly seems to enjoy his day. Whenever I pick him up, I peek into the room and see him playing happily with his friends.  \n\nIn the short time that he's been there he's become much more vocal. I love catching him singing and humming to himself.  Communication is also great with their app where I'm regularly sent updates on his naps, feeding and his activities for the day.  We're happy to be apart of this warm community.

review.author: Rob K.
review.description:
We are new to the Shining Smiles family but we are thrilled to be apart of it. When my wife and I were touring daycares, we were looking for caring attentive staff, bright clean facilities, good communication, flexibility, and community. 

Shining Smiles delivers in every way.  My son loves going to "school" and every day his vocabulary is growing.  With their app, I get to see how he is doing during the day and communicate with the teachers if we have any questions.  

They also hold events for families - over Halloween, all of the families were invited for a special fall party and we can't wait to attend the Thanksgiving potluck.  We're new to the area so this is an especially great way to meet local families.

review.author: Anna S.
review.description: Shining Smiles is a wonderful day care center. I was very nervous to send my daughter to daycare for the first time, but she quickly bonded with the care givers and is receiving exceptional care. The staff are all very nice and wonderful with both the children and their parents. I have been very happy with the level of communication and like the app they use to communicate as well (especially the cute photos!). The facility itself is new, clean and cheerful and they offer stroller storage.

review.author: Josh T.
review.description: Our 5 month old has been at Shining Smiles for about 6 weeks now. SS has been a great place for him - the entire team is incredibly communicative, caring, respectful, etc. The facilities are very clean (brand new!). We are very happy to have our child at Shining Smiles and have already tried to get our family to bring their baby there as well.

review.author: Lauren S.
review.description: My son has been going to Shining Smiles since the 1-year old room opened in September 2019. It has been an incredible experience to have him cared for by genuinely wonderful people. He struggled a bit in the beginning with the transition to daycare but the team handled it beautifully, and with a lot of patience. Now, he jumps in his stroller in the morning, excited to see his teachers and friends. Literally. \n\nThe teachers are excellent, the staff is communicative (love the app!!), and the space is clearly purpose-built for a daycare. All around, we couldn't be happier with our experience at Shining Smiles!

review.author: Kelly K.
review.description: Outstanding program and facility! We have two children in the program (one infant, one three year old) and we could not be happier with the exceptional learning experiences and childcare that Shining Smiles is providing. The classrooms are bright and filled with all sorts of age/developmentally appropriate toys and activity stations, and the highly-trained professional staff are all loving, warm, and fun--we feel incredibly lucky to have found such a wonderful school/daycare. Our son wakes up every day asking to go to "big boy school," and we love watching him learn and grow as he moves through the Shining Smiles pre-school curriculum. He is also acquiring new social skills and life skills, such as how to work collaboratively and how to use safety scissors. Our baby is picking up new things every day, and she gets her mental and physical workouts every day through story time, sign language lessons, art projects, and gross-motor activities such as the all-important tummy time! She is also gaining skills such as how to wave hello and good-bye and how to drink from a sippy-cup. Weather-permitting, the staff takes the children out in the neighborhood or to the playground--donned in their cute in their little Shining Smiles smocks! The staff and management are extremely professional and responsive, and communication is conducted mostly through an app through which they share messages as well as frequent daily updates on the basics such as meals, bathroom breaks, and naps. They also send photos of the days activities, which brighten my day. I would give Shining Smiles more stars if I could. We attended the Gold Street location before my son      was of pre-school age, and we received the same outstanding care from amazing, loving, caring professionals there. Book your tour!

review.author: Rashi G.
review.description: Such a fun class to do- by yourself or with a partner. We came on a Friday evening and had so much fun making a lamp. We had 5 to choose from and they gave us tutorials on how to cut, solder, and glue the pipes together. We loved Shannon! She was so sweet and attentive and just an easy person to talk to. The whole class is 3 hours and definitely worth it!

review.author: Rachel B.
review.description: My husband and I had the best time forging our survival knife. We weren't exactly sure what to expect, but our instructor Gerard was an absolute pro and made the experience incredibly fun, interesting and memorable. The beer, wine and local pizza was an added bonus. Highly recommend for a unique date night!

review.author: Victoria K.
review.description: AMAZING place.  The whole concept is you come out of a fun 3-4 hour class with a beautiful FINISHED piece, starting with zero skills. The sense of achievement is unparalleled, the teachers are great and you really learn in a cool, fun environment. They even have wine/beer (after you've used the dangerous tools).  Cool space with genuinely creative maker community. EXCELLENT for anyone tired of the desk life and yearning to rediscover real things.

review.author: CanCan B.
review.description: I found out about Craftsman Ave just a few days before our wedding anniversary and it felt like a fun change from the usual "fancy dinner" anniversary celebration. \nWhen we signed up to make copper lamps, we chose it expressly because of the date of the class being near our anniversary, and were pleasantly surprised that the date night package included wine from a local Gowanus wine store and pizza from Table 87. I had never heard of Tabel 87 either (I guess I live under a rock, or in Manhattan) but I will now be a fan for the rest of my days.\nI have NEVER made anything like a lamp or even cut copper pipes, but the guide was so laid back and gave great direction. I felt like I was really doing it myself but I also didn't feel nervous or self conscious about my lack of experiencing soldering or using a pipe cutter. I feel pretty awesome about myself after the whole experience, and my husband who was initially a reluctant participant was inspired to try out other workshops in the future. We will be back!

review.author: Sean K.
review.description:
This place is a true NYC gem!  Sometimes you just need to make things and this is a perfect outlet.  

Very laid back, friendly vibe.  I was lucky enough to get a four-hour private stained glass lesson with Kelsie McNair, and while I have a lot to practice and plenty more to learn, I feel equipped enough to practice on my own.  

Soup to nuts, we went from design idea, to material selection and through all key steps of the process to make a window hanger.  As a novice, I'm surprised I walked away with anything respectable but I did!  All the while, Kelsie, the instructor and Chris the manager were good natured and supportive. They are people you'd happily hang out with and made it very easy to learn from.  

Today far exceeded expectations and increased my interest in the craft.  This session was a gift and I would recommend it for others.

review.author: Jessica B.
review.description: I walked out of there with a very cute leather bag and had a great time with both the instructors and the people in the class.  I would absolutely recommend highly.

review.author: Rick N.
review.description:
I took a 4-hour Saturday morning Introduction to MIG welding class and I loved it! The class size was small, and so we had tons hands-on practice and loads of interaction with our awesome instructor Jerome, who was knowledgeable, patient, and super friendly. Jerome began the class by giving us an overview of the steps that we would take to fabricate a metal planter. Next, he explained each step and the proper use of each tool as we completed each stage toward our final result. He ensured that students were  adhering to safe and proper use of tools throughout, as he offered encouragement and tips to ensure a better result. All told, I couldn't ask for a better experience, and is exactly the entry-point that I needed to start practicing these skills on my own.

Although Craftsman Ave is a good distance from my NJ home, I'm strongly considering taking another class. If they offer the Customize Your Own Motorcycle class again, I will crawl through broken glass to attend. If they open a Montclair, NJ branch of this place, I'm renting the apartment above. 

If you haven't grinded down welds while listening to rock cranking in the background, you haven't lived!

review.author: Paul S.
review.description: Had a great evening at Craftsman Ave. It's like a high school shop class, but really cool and lots of fun. Jeff and Jerry taught us how to use all kinds of tools to weld a planter out of metal!! \nWe had a nice meal and wine. Looking forward to our next project!

review.author: Kelly O.
review.description: We had an amazing experience at Craftsman Ave! Jeff is an absolute pleasure to work with and made it such an amazing experience. We are looking forward to going back to our next workshop. If you are considering coming here, don't think twice! Such a fun time.

review.author: Rob H.
review.description: I took Craftsman Ave's "Make a Steel Planter Box (Introduction to Welding and Metal Fabrication)" class this past weekend and had a blast. The instructor was knowledgeable and the perfect amount of hands on. The space is very cool and safety was top notch. This won't be my last time at Craftsman Ave. Thanks guys!

review.author: Sarah M.
review.description: For partner and my 5 year anniversary we took the date night class to make a side table. This was an incredible experience. Jeff and his assistant Arlene were very friendly, fun, and knowledgeable about woodworking. Prior to the class , Jeff made us homemade hot dogs and hamburgers and we were also serenaded by rock jams from the 90's! Overall we were able to use three different types of saws, as well as sanders and other tools. Afterwards we all enjoyed a beer together. I would highly recommend heading to Craftsman Ave. for any of the listed classes or services!

review.author: Diara B.
review.description:
Craftsman Ave is great! I took the Intro to Metal Fabrication class and although it can sound intimidating at first, it was easy to follow along and the instructor was super helpful. 

We had a choice between making a tray or stool, and I picked the stool. We finished the class a bit later but we all got to go home with a beautiful finished product.

I will definitely take more classes!

review.author: Ji Hae B.
review.description:
I took the Intro to Metal Fabrication class and learned so much + had so much fun making my stool. Liam, my instructor was extremely kind, patient and thoroughly explained the process / reasons very clearly. I would recommend taking esp. if you are not intimidated by power tools and want to build something awesome to take home and learn a new hands skill set! 


Thanks Craftsman Ave and Liam!

review.author: Adam M.
review.description: Went to a birthday party here and made a table. Great experience. Fun, nice teacher and learned a bunch. Would definitely recommend!

review.author: Lizz H.
review.description:
I just took my second class and again, had a fantastic time! I first took the Lettering class which was really inspiring and informative and just took the soap-making class where we made a whole pound of soap to take home. 

I love Craftsman Ave because the class sizes are VERY small and it makes for a very hands-on, informal experience with a lot of individual attention. The staff is incredible friendly and helpful; I've interacted with Jayson and he is the best!

I plan to take more classes here and have been recommending Craftsman Ave to all my curious and crafty friends.

review.author: Conni M.
review.description:
Wood / saw dust can be major health issue.  Some woods are extremely toxic to breath in and some folks are allergic without ever knowing it until they experience it. 

At Craftman's there are no ceiling, floor or individual hook up ventilation systems to filter and bag the wood dust from the table saw, band saw or sander.  A cloud of dust enveloped the table saw as we cut about two dozen pieces of wood.  This lead me to notice the amount of wood dust coating the walls and surrounding all the wood working equipment. 

The class was ok, but the amount of wood dust makes it unsafe for me to take another class with them.

If you take a wood class there, I would advise bringing one of those throw away nurses mask and a set of ear plugs.  They provide safety glasses.

review.author: Ilana G.
review.description: We organized a small group (8 people) private intro to modern woodworking course and had a great time with Jeff! This was for a 30th birthday with a bunch of people who had no experience, and it was a huge success. We left with great tables and Jeff made the whole thing feel super celebratory and fun. One of the group member's table didn't exactly hold together by the end of the night so Jeff fixed it and sent it to him in the mail! 10/10 recommend!!

review.author: Kathleen O.
review.description:
Craftsman Avenue is a craft/maker space opposite Lowe's on 11th between 2nd and 3rd Ave. 

They have classes on woodworking, jewelry making, motorcycle design, lettering etc. and offer studio space.

It's a great space, clean, open. I had a lot of fun making earrings in the jewelry class and I am definitely going back for more.

review.author: Sonia D.
review.description: I took the intro to metal fabrication class and it was so much fun. I learned how to weld and form metal. We got to build a stool or tray; both ended up looking great. The instructor is knowledgeable and helpful. I definitely recommend it.

review.author: Alicia N.
review.description: I got this class as a gift for my boyfriend partially based on the rave reviews for the highly experienced scheduled instructor. However, the instructor was switched out at the last minute for a college student who had never taught a class and time went way over, so we missed other plans that evening. I understand that scheduling issues happen but it is up to CA to notify students and/or compensate for the different quality of course

review.author: Susan L.
review.description: The Fitness Center will have a full renovation and therefore it will be closed from Sept. 8-14.

review.author: Christine A.
review.description: This review is not for the gym. There's a lot that goes on at Manny Cantor Center from classes for kids, adults and older adults, to space that you can rent for events. It's a beautiful well-maintained building. It's very accessible to all, with great facilities. I've never had any rudeness from any of the guards. Everyone has been professional and friendly.

review.author: Peter D.
review.description:
The Manny Cantor Center, where I witnessed a boy become a man. (It was a bar mitzvah, you creep.) And it was a beautiful ceremony of acceptance into the Jewish community.

This was actually my first time at the Manny Cantor Center, but I found it to be quite pleasant. The security guards were friendly, the bathrooms were clean and nice, and most importantly, the event space up on the 6th floor was clean and well-lit, with an outdoor area that had a great view of the sunset. 

I'd recommend it for all your bar mitzvah needs.

review.author: Yesenia G.
review.description: Great location for corporate parties, graduate schools, and more. I took some great photos of The 24th PILA Gala Event. Excellent Event. The Amy was awesome and so was the staff.

review.author: Jenn C.
review.description: I had my wedding here in May, and it was such a lovely space! The ceremony and cocktail hour were done before sunset, and the event space was filled with light. The reception was after sunset, and with the lights out and candles everywhere, the room was dark and beautiful with the city lights outside. I was a little worried after being warned about being too loud, the neighbors complaining, etc, but nothing at all happened! Go talk to Amy (the rental manager) and tell her you want to hold your happy occasions there. You'll be doing a mitzvah!

review.author: Sabrina H.
review.description:
Signed up for the gym here a month ago and Manny Cantor has been like a second home. It's on the small side but I've found the community here incredibly inclusive and genuinely non-judgmental. The mixed reviews on here seem misleading as they are for different services.

Pros: Price, I signed up for the $70/month family deal, which isn't bad at all given the convenience, service, classes offered, and knowing my money is going to a local, community center and not a chain with difficult contracts and surcharges. I signed up with Mallory and she was personable and friendly, giving me a in-depth tour while patiently answering all of my questions.

-Classes are fun and small. So far, I've been to spinning and Zumba. Instructors were friendly and attentive.

-Cleanliness is an A+, I go in the late morning or late at night. It's always spotless and cleaning stations are always stocked.

-Music is great. It's an eclectic mix with songs like Daddy Yankee's "Gasolina" and chill, indie-pop. Whoever is making the playlists needs to be posting it online. The volume is on the low-side as many work out to their own music, but I've definitely stopped mid-workout to Shazam a song or two. 

Cons: None! I'm a happy camper and love it!

review.author: Louise D.
review.description:
ABOUT THE FITNESS CENTER  :  DIRTY. 

I first subscribe more than a year ago. The place was brand new and very clean.

Now, there is a lot more people, the restroom are filthy, the fitness room's floor is disgusting because people come from outside with their shoes : how am I suppose to put my face close to this floor where I can see hair, dirt, sweat spots ??!

I've been many time to morning yoga classes, and they allow people to get in when they are late, during the meditation part, and even when it's super crowded. Disrespectful. People complained, and nothing was ever done. 

Last time I've been, it was very hot and there was no AC....... Out of order for two month !!!!!!

Some teachers are amazing (especially Chintamani, Stephen, or Carolina) but I'm very angry against the management : There use to be classic amazing Pilates classes, and now there is only pretentious cardio Pilates, with marketing names like "POP Pilates".... which I find ridiculous and has nothing to do with Pilates, and everything to do with cardio and gym. Pilates has a purpose. And it's NOT to be fast. Please, there was plenty of other workout such as Zumba which includes cardio. AND EVEN IF sometimes a class is not overcrowded doesn't mean there is no need for this kind of class. Not everyone needs to be sore or risk a heart attack to feel thin. 

- You've lost me. -

review.author: Jana K.
review.description:
It's my gym because it's the closest place in my neighborhood and I like the people who run it, but there are more cons than pros lately.

Pros: 
-Price (take advantage of student pricing or family membership!) 
-clean most of the time
-friendly people
-decent cardio zone
-It's in a neighborhood that desperately needs more gyms.

Cons: 
-nearly NO space for free-weight training. You can train in the room where group classes take place, but when there is class in session you're out of luck and have to work out in the small space next to cardio zone- there is space for 3 people comfortably, maybe 4. And have to watch out for people walking by.
-NO towels
-for the past 3 months, there have been no wet desinfecting wipes- only paper towels and some spray in bottles; combined with no towels... you get the idea (I don't understand why they wouldn't buy some more wipes.....)

Neutral:
-classes are ok most of the time
-almost empty often, but crowded 6-8pm

review.author: Bonsai C.
review.description:
This review only applies to the BASKETBALL COURTS. 

Here are the hours:

Saturday: 7AM-11AM
Sunday: 7AM-11AM
Monday: 6AM-8AM/8PM-10PM
Tuesday: 6AM-8AM/12PM-3PM
Wednesday: 6AM-8AM/12PM-3PM
Thursday: 6AM-8AM/12PM-3PM
Friday: 6AM-8AM/7PM-10PM

Basically put, these HOURS SUCK ASS. Why would you even build brand new BASKETBALL COURTS, if we can't even use them for BASKETBALL!

For those of us who work 9-5 jobs, the only times we can really play are Monday night 8PM-10PM, Friday night 7PM-10PM, and weekend MORNINGS. COME ON SON. This is ridiculous. Monday to Friday 6AM-8AM? NOBODY WILL GO DURING THAT TIME - WHO'S EVEN AWAKE DURING THIS TIME?!. 12PM-3PM? People got work/school. WHAT A JOKE.

Don't even bother trying to go outside of these hours because security will just come in and kick you out. WHY CAN'T WE USE THE COURTS EVEN IF THEIR NOT BEING RENTED OR USED BY OTHER DEPARTMENTS? SMH.

What a waste of a space and a gym. It really is a damn shame because these courts are new and decent...now if only we can PLAY BASKETBALL ON THEM. SMH.

When I joined this gym, I was told that the basketball courts would be mostly accessible unless it was only being rented - apparently, that is not the case anymore because they wouldn't even let you use to it play ball even when it's not being used! I WANT MY MONEY BACK!

review.author: Carmen Y.
review.description:
Gym review: the gym is just average. The reason why I got a membership was because it was close and cheaper than other gyms. Still pricey though.  However I just cancelled this month because I don't use the gym enough that will make it worth it. 

The bathroom is quite small compared to other places. It's fairly clean. It has lockers but you have to bring your own locks. Don't expect towels or any other things here. 

I took some classes. The spin class teacher was good but I stopped because my knee started to hurt. The other classes I took were not challenging enough. It's more for people who are starting to get into shape. I like more intense classes. And I'm not into yoga so I don't know how that is. Some of the classes you have to pay extra which is a bit annoying. 

It's an okay gym. If you just need a place to work out with basic machines.. then it's good. It gets a bit crowded around 5-7 on weekdays. 

I wish it had a pool then I would more likely to stay.

review.author: Jay L.
review.description:
The gym is OK,

The gym overall is a very nice and clean gym. The staff are usually nice except that asian guy in the front desk who's super petty and uninformed. He acts like it's his first day and hes not very good and talking. He's super extra and requires needs every tiny detail

The gym is overpriced.
A membership for one person is around $60/mo for a person. Paying this much money, you would expect a pool or at least towels maybe even wet wipes. Nope. The cardio section is large and nice but there's a small weight lifting section and only one of each machine.The lockers and bathrooms are decent.

The basketball court is pathetic. Their hours for the courts are ridiculous and you still aren't allowed to use them when no one else is. They are opened on wack hours so you never actually get a chance to use them. 

If you can, i would definitely recommend a different gym. It's not worth it.

review.author: Aria S.
review.description: I took an art class at the educational alliance in lower east side. The old location basically. The people were rude and the teacher who was teaching my class (honestly don't remember his name). After class one day I asked him if constant practice would help me to be a better at drawing and painting in general and his response was "No, it's not that simple, most people are born with this talent and even if it does happen it would take a really really long time". So my question is why am I paying for taking a class there??? With teachers like that you don't need strangers walking all over you. \nNeedless to say I never took a class there again.

review.author: Jay A.
review.description:
This is a glorified basement gym.

This is an update to my first review. 3 months after joining now this have gone from meh, to worse. Here are the reasons why:
They fixed the showers BUT, the benches that were finally put in are not secured.

There is missing weight equipment.
You cannot work out your calves, you cannot do curls, you cannot do head crushers, bent over rows, all because there is no preacher curl bar or calf machine.

They close at 10PM!!!
It's the city that never sleeps but this gym has a curfew?!

The maintenance people are sometimes in the men's locker room cleaning up before its time to close. All the jump ropes are broken

They send emails constantly about changes to the classes being taught. 

There are routine alterations being done to the building that limit the gyms availability or take up time. 

The music being played over the PA is always too loud or too faint.

I'd give this place 2 stars on just the fact that the equipment is new. However the equipment is limiting and has list it's newness in me.

One good thing to note is that I've had very good experiences with people at the counter and the trainers.

review.author: Jacq O.
review.description:
I have to say that I LOVE it.  I am a native LES resident since birth, and I was very excited to hear about this gym coming to our neighborhood, I joined last fall as a Charter member, the open date was pushed a few times and yes there were a few snags to get through just like it would be with any business opening its doors, (first few weeks they had no hot water in the women's locker room) but that has been fixed.  They took a little while to get benches and stools in the locker rooms, but also has been resolved. The other issue that came up early on were the ID's, but also resolved.  In essence those issues are non issues at this point. 

The age limit is 16 and over just like any other gym which makes sense, they have convenient daycare on the 1st floor for children up to 6 or 7 I believe which is helpful. 

Facilities: They are clean, well kept, beautiful, there are plenty of machines, lots of space, the room for aerobic classes is expansive, it is where I do my stretching, where many go to stretch, do free weights, jump rope or do stepping on their own. Also there are lots of classes to choose from, I have participated in the Masala with Chloe (she is great!) and in the Zumba classes which is included in the monthly price. Yes like some reviewers have said on here, classes are sometimes subbed last minute, but I'm sure that happens elsewhere, instructors are human too and things come up understandably. They have YOGA on the 6th floor where you can experience sunrise or sunset beautifully. 

The staff: they always welcome members with a smile, are helpful, professional, not once so far have been concerned with customer service.  Brien Jones the GM is super. He says hello, stops and talks to folks, asks how people are doing, I get the feeling that he really cares and is dedicated to running a smooth operation.  He is approachable and knowledgeable about fitness. I needed help and asked him a question about normal heart rates and he was able to be helpful to me. 

I am actually going to add my husband to my membership just in time for Father's Day weekend.

review.author: Sabrina M.
review.description: This rewiew is directed towards the early education program. First off let me start by saying I was very enthusiastic about putting my toddler there because the building is so beautifully done I signed her up when I was in desperate need of childcare she was about 1 year old. I had a staff member named Maria who helped me tremendously she resides in the neighborhood and she really wanted to reach out and help out so I applaud her for her for her help with this situation. Now my daughter is nearly 3 years old and still not placed into manny cantor center I've gotten at least two phone calls not from Maria from for other staff saying that a process opened up for her but it was on Avenue D. I live on Clinton Street and I was not going to go out of my way when manny cantor center is right around the corner from my house the second call was to say that was a slot open up at PS 140 which too is a distance away from my home and work to say the least I have opted out of trying anymore I'm very disgruntled and the staff other than Maria didn't seem to be interested in helping the community when you look at the makeup of the class  you're most likely going to see (no disrespect)all Asian and white students.  This community is a very diverse community and should reflect on the classmates in the classroom however majority of the blacks and Hispanics are being placed in other locations I want to give a big negative shout out to the manny cantor educational Alliance for not supporting their community.\nP.s. if they call me now for placement I will decline my daughter is in a great learning environment and is thriving. thank you very much

review.author: Angel P.
review.description: Females doing workouts in the bathroom because some of these men are creeps besides that the place is nice.\nThat's what the females tell each other in the bathroom shame lol

review.author: Eva Y.
review.description: I really like the affordable gym and the workout classes they offer.   The workout classes are my favorite and so far I've tried the Pilates, yoga and masala Bhangra and I love it. The staff is friendly and place is clean.

review.author: Shawn H.
review.description: Writing this review for the gym. I really like the staff, very friendly. Equipment and locker rooms are always clean and it's never too busy when I usually go. The price for membership is also very low compared to other gyms in the area.

review.author: Sunny Y.
review.description: Love the gym!  the staff is warm and fantastic.  they are friendly and encourage me to push just a little bit harder.  the facilities are clean.  during the hours that I come, which is before 8am, there aren't that many people there, so I feel like i have the gym pretty much to myself.  I enjoy the morning yoga classes, and work out with a private trainer once a week.  everything is very reasonable priced, and even on a sliding scale. \n\nLove it!

review.author: LISA Y.
review.description: Cancelled my membership in  July 2016 and Sarah the manager still charged me August, September and October.  When they went to charge my account in November the payment would not go through and that was the only reason that I knew because Sarah called me to say payment was declined.  Horrible place!!

review.author: Samantha S.
review.description:
One of my kids went to BHSEC Manhattan, and the other is now at BHSEC Queens. (I apologize in advance for any overlap in my reviews.) Both schools will give kids a top-notch education, but the schools are not for everyone. 

Bard Manhattan was the first of its kind, a public high school with an accelerated program that takes 2 years to complete. The second two years are for college-level work (and, indeed, kids graduate after 4 years total with both a HS diploma and an A.A. degree from Bard College). Those 2 years of college credits can be transferred to some 4-year colleges, giving kids who want it a huge savings in both time and money.

So the work is advanced and fast-moving: that's a given. Kids have to take a placement exam (not the SHSAT) to qualify, but even if you do well, it's hard to say whether BHSEC Manhattan is for you. It's a small school, and there aren't as many clubs as you can find elsewhere. Sports are not a huge part of the culture here. It's a long walk/bus ride from the nearest subway line. Writing is very important; you don't have to be a great writer at 14, but you should probably be open to improving in this area.

Those are the caveats. 

The benefits of this school are enormous. The quality of the faculty is amazingly high (lots of PhD's), and they were always accessible for advice/extra help/mentoring. The administration was responsive, in my experience. College counseling was knowledgeable and hands-on.

The classes are small and most are seminar-style. Lots of discussion, lots of back-and-forth in the classroom, lots of writing (see above). Expectations are high; you're expected to work hard and be intellectually curious. If you want big lectures, multiple-choice tests, and anonymity--forget it. 

The BHSEC model has expanded to Newark, Cleveland, and New Orleans. Clearly, there's a demand for accelerated HS education. For the right kid, these schools will be life-changing. As with any educational choice, the key is to know yourself.

review.author: aya natalia k.
review.description: My son was at New Amsterdam for early childhood, and my daughter is currently in the mixed-aged kindergarten class. I love that she spends time outside in the garden every day, I love the caring and warm teachers. Each day holds its own special rhythm, activities are creative yet simple, food is wholesome. \n\nThe classrooms are like a calm (but every-playful!) oasis in the middle of our city. I also feel supported as a parent, whether through parent groups, observing teacher interactions, or attending their community lectures.

review.author: Jacqueline L.
review.description:
Really just confused and disappointed in the admissions process.. I loved the enviorment and wanted to sign up my son and received such positive feedback while there. Once I wanted to move forward my emails & calls went unanswered... 


about 2 weeks later several calls/emails, I received an email that the teacher thought my son was too old for the current class offered but then I received a call saying that the current teacher was leaving the school and that there was a possibility they would make it work but that they would call me back once they had a new teacher...

5 months later im still waiting for a call...

review.author: nathan l.
review.description: We've sent our daughter here for the past four years. Beautiful environment, lovely caring teachers. Small classes and a true 'family' feeling. She's flourished here and refuses to miss a day of school!

review.author: Kaarin V.
review.description: New Amsterdam has been like a second home for my child. She has grown and thrived academically, emotionally, socially and in a true inward way. The school has been a blessing for our family. We couldn't be happier with the school and its approach to education.

review.author: Wei W.
review.description: My daughter began her journey at age 2 at New Amsterdam School in the parent-child class and is now beginning her 4th year there. It truly is a haven within the concrete jungle. The teachers are respectful of each other, are nurturing, and I couldn't have imagined a more loving teacher-child connection. The classroom and school environment are beautiful with use of natural and organic materials, and with wholesome food prepared, it really is a place that nourishes the whole child. My daughter loves school from day one and does not want the school day to end!

review.author: T H.
review.description:
My daughter started there at parent child classes, then Kindergarten , then Grades 1 and 2.

Very nice school, the environment of classes is intended to make the children enjoy and learn at the same time. It is important to say that this school's education system is based on Waldorf education.

Child development focus is towards healthy social development, healthy food and proper level of readiness before the child is taken to the next level in their education.

We were instructed not to put pressure on her homework and only assist her is she ask for help, she now picks up books by herself and read them willingly and happy. Also gets up early in the morning to finish the homework without pressure from us or the teacher.

I just read a august 2016 review where communication was not clear or sufficient to a parent. This is sadly something that needs work, and I am sure the school is addressing after seeing the review. I truly feel sad for this parent. 

Keep in mind that we went there because we wanted the best for our child's education and we accepted the other little things that could have bothered us.

A well known phrase that applies here is:
"'If the mountain will not come to Muhammad, then Muhammad must go to the mountain"

review.author: Susan J.
review.description: My children are blossoming in this school!\n\nWe applied to Altschool when I saw my son starting to shut down in public school in the 2nd grade. A bright child, his academics were never a problem, but he started hating school, all the homework for homework sake & the many rules that made him feel uncomfortable every expressing himself. He was becoming depressed at the age of 7. Things have changed drastically now that he is in Altschool with teachers who regularly encourage him to speak up and has internalized the notion that his thoughts are important. He sets goals for himself (work better with others, always have sources for project points) and actively pushes himself to get better. His curiosity is back in full bloom, he takes an interest in and asks questions about everything.  Altschool values things like grit, optimism, resilience, gratitude, purpose etc. These are the kind of values every school should focus on. We feel privileged that not only does our child go to a school that is innovating education for our kids, they are also building a platform that will help teachers and administrators around the country so that more children can benefit in a sustainable way. Last but not least, I deeply appreciate the wonderful and diverse parent community in Altschool is so committed and involved in the school. It is a bunch of forward thinking professionals that have a higher standard of education for our children and are committed to work towards making sure our children get the kind of education they deserve.

review.author: Fernando F.
review.description:
I have two kids at Alt School Brooklyn Heights. I think Alt does one thing better than anyone else, which is to teach kids to love going to school, to teach them to love to learn. I've spent some time trying to figure out how they do this and I believe it has to do with four big assets they have: 1) a personalized education combined with project-based learning (that ensures a lot of fun for all students), 2) a solid back-end technology platform to keep track of learning progress by subject matter (that ensures that students are actually learning), 3) top-notch teachers that come from top US schools (Alt school gives teachers complete freedom to chose their teaching method and projects), and 4) partnerships with the neighborhood (my kids have PE class at the Brooklyn Pier 5 and have a school trip about once every two or three weeks).  
I am particularly happy with the staff and teachers. We have a strong bond, they are available to talk at any time, any day about any topic. If my kids are falling behind in a particular topic, they are fully aware and at the same time, they develop a plan with me to increase the learning progress. I've had nothing but friendly encounters with everyone at the school.  
Finally, being a relatively new and modern school means they are pretty solid on the user experience as parents. The application process was incredibly easy (they have an ongoing basis application, several open house days, they encourage and set up conversations with current parents for further diligence, absolute transparency about the process, etc), all the required paperwork was done through their website, and once enrolled parents have access to the Stream app with daily reports on student progress, notices, and everything related to admin (sick days, tuition, extended day, etc). 
It's been a fantastic experience and I fully recommend Alt School.

review.author: Nish N.
review.description: I brought one of my daughters here for an interview. We were running late so I tried calling the 866 number on their site. I received an automated system that transferred me to the Brooklyn location to then still not speak to anyone. I was on the phone with my husband giving him directions to meet me, when someone finally came to the door 20 minutes later. I was then told by a young woman sorry we will call to reschedule. Few days later I received an email saying they will not be moving forward with any of my children applications. One week later I took my other two daughters for an interview and was told due to the fact I was on my phone the last time I was there, I was judged based off of that and my kids will not be accepted. How do you judge my children or me because I was on a call with MY HUSBAND for directions? They had no clue who I was speaking to and regarding what matter. I would definitely NOT recommend this school to anyone, there are a lot of other good private schools with more reputable reputations.

review.author: Keith T.
review.description: I just flew aboard Kenai Aviation's new Tecnam 2012 plane that is regularly flying between Anchorage, Kenai, and Homer.  The plane is new and pretty nice to fly aboard.  USB charging ports are available at each seat.  I was informed that they will schedule more flights in Spring 2023.

review.author: Brig C.
review.description: This is a first class operation. We were stranded on the Kenai peninsula because of fires and had to change plans quick to get to Anchorage to keep our travel itinerary. We called Kenai Aviation last minute and they scrambled and got us where we needed to go that night. Very experienced pilots (our pilot also flies commercial jet airliners for Alaska Airlines and had been piloting for 20+ years) and super friendly people. Great family business. Smooth flight and first rate service. Will definitely use them again for their sight-seeing flights and any time we need a charter on the Kenai peninsula.  Cannot say enough about the quality of this company.

review.author: Spencer A.
review.description: So far I have purchased 2 properties with Warren of Jack White Realty. I cannot say enough good things about Warren. He was very communicative, above board, upfront, and a professional willing to go the extra for a customer - like physically driving to a property in your staid to verify a question or concern. \n\nA good realtor is like a good mechanic, you only use them.

review.author: Lois B.
review.description: We'd heard of MARC from fellow aviators, so arranged to stop by (via road - not wings) while on vacation.  The receptionist was very generous with her time and cheerfully gave us a tour during which she explained the history and current objectives of MARC.  She introduced us to team members as we walked thru the various areas.  Staff and volunteers were all very friendly and happy to answer our questions.

review.author: Mike F.
review.description: Learning to weld is an extraordinary experience.  This workshop, given to me as a gift from a friend, got me started with the basic techniques of MIG.  Michelle is an expert teacher and guides you every step of the way to lay down a clean bead. The studio, totally Covid-safe, has large side by side open windows that allow for easy air circulation. There is a breeze from the waterfront.\nMy first time holding a torch I got hooked,  I love the small sculpture that I made. I now have it on display in my apartment. When I go back for another class, I will bring a friend to share the experience and fun. Who knew metalwork could be so exciting? But then Michelle Greene has been the master welding professor at the New School for decades, so I had high expectations!

review.author: Gayle U.
review.description:
Michelle's class was great. I'm a beginner and this was the first time I held a torch. She explained Everything to me. Sal who knows how to weld was also impressed with the way she worked with him. Can not recommend her enough. Worth every penny 

Thank you Michelle 

Sal and Gayle

review.author: Remy G.
review.description:
Just did a one-on-one 2-hour class with Michelle and I can't recommend it highly enough. Michelle was smart and clear and an excellent teacher. She gauged my ability and comfort zone well and we progressed through the basics of Oxy-acetylene welding at the exact right pace for me. 

I walked out of there with a very clear sense of how to get started with what I need to do (and a candle holder!) I definitely need more practice and may go back to her for another session, but I'm very glad I spent the money and did the solo session rather than being in a class setting that others offer.  

Come to think of it, even the choice of the candle-holder project she came up with reflected the attention she put into it, because we used the same material that I want to use in a project, so the practice was tailor made for real-life.

review.author: Michael F.
review.description:
Had a great experience with Michelle!  Great instruction tailored to giving me (a novice) an overview of fabrication and welding.  Her technical expertise and approach to design is terrific.

Exactly what I was looking for as I'd never welded or for that matter, built anything with my hands.

Personal and hands-on instruction. 

Highly recommended and well worth the money!

review.author: Michael G.
review.description: I still cant believe she "exists"- the ultimate welding instructor, available for individual (and small group) training. I'm an "intermediate" welder, beginner sculptor. I wanted TIG lessons + to enhance MIG and stick. Michelle is a true expert at ALL + great teacher! She was an art student, union welder on boilers (!), certification trainer to metallurgical engineers, and more! HIGHLY RECOMMEND, especially for  people with experience. Not "cheap", but worth every penny!

review.author: jaret s.
review.description: Just had my first class at the Brooklyn Navy Yard with Michelle and I really enjoyed it! I learned a ton, make some cool stuff, and I can't wait to go back. Her class is exactly what I was looking for. Until now, I've never welded before and needed a primer on the different types of welding, so I could go off on my own. Michelle tailored the class to my needs, is a great instructor, and a talented welder. You can't learn this stuff from a text book or a google search.

review.author: David M.
review.description: Excellent teachers. I've had 3 kids graduate from there and working on a 4th. Go purple Panthers!!!

review.author: David M.
review.description: Great little college campus right on the river. Very friendly place to go to school.

review.author: Grant B.
review.description: This business offers wood products for  sale, but also classes to teach woodworking skills.  We took the 1/2 day beginner class where you make a bowl from a chunk of wood.  As a person with 5 thumbs and cannot draw a straight line, I made a beautiful bowl.  The instructor is very patient and good at fixing your mistakes. Wonderful class, learned a lot, and walked out with a nice token of my talent (or lack of talent).   If you are looking for a fun family outing, want to learn something new, or a place to go during a rainy day, this is a great place.

review.author: Romain M.
review.description: My son went here for 2.5 years. Welcoming, caring and friendly staff and owners. This care center was a God sent, my son felt right at home. The environment was clean and my son had a great learning experience that gave him a head start for kindergarten. Thank you first of all to Ms. Jennifer, so caring and friendly. My son loved her. Sharyn is always there to help and is so patient and understanding. Ms. Keisha is full of energy, friendly and understanding. God bless you guys!!

review.author: Kyla Z.
review.description:
Ms. Tracy is full of energy and kindness.  She encouraged and supported my son and his driving.  
It takes about two weeks to be done with behind the wheel.  And it costs $220.   It was much easier than trying to schedule it with his school.  


Thank you!

review.author: Donald S.
review.description:
I just completed the 8 hour course 11-05-2014 and I am so glad that I chose this driving school. The instructor was engaging, relevant and current with important information about the rules of the road in Virginia in addition to the standard driving course curriculum. I recommend to anyone who has a need for drivers training that they should attend Tri-City Driving School! Ms Evans is an outstanding instructor and she won't let you down! 

                                       Donald Shipp
                                       US Army, (RET.)

review.author: Olivia H.
review.description:
Been attending JTCC since Fall of 2016 for Science Specialization to transfer. I was dual enrolled for two years at one of the tech centers for baking/ pastry arts and culinary arts. But when I was 'enrolling' for fall classes, I went for guidance on program selecting and class enrollment from a counselor (tall, Caucasian, glasses, Moyar hall). He was rude, asked as if I was supposed to know exactly what to do when I first stepped foot into the college for the first time. I asked step by step on how to enroll for classes, instead of showing me on a computer or directing me to another staff member, he handed me a brochure on how to do it and said I need to go home and learn for myself. Then a few days later, I went to Wendy, she guided me through it. She was great, and made the process look easy.
But when payment deadlines came along (usually in July for fall enrollment), I was denied financial aid 2 days before payments were due, do I had to use a credit card to pay, which I had no places on doing.
But within the last 5 semesters I've attended, my 'student routine/ daily life' was decent. There were plenty of activities and academic events for everyone.
But some students are plain ruthless, rude, disruptive, and distractive. Some instructors allowed students to noisily come into class late. Others would allow students to constantly raise their hands for questions that have nothing to do with the learning material.
Example: I was in my 8am BIO 102 class. A girl arrives 30 minutes late. 5 minutes into her arrival to class, she raises her hand and asks "What are we learning? I don't understand it." How do you not understand the general idea of a class's material if you need the prerequisites of BIO 101 and MTE 1-9 before you take BIO 102?
Some students don't have access to grants, loans, scholarships, or financial aid so it would be nice if instructors were more strict on students being disruptive and distractive.
UPDATE:
Just got my 'program'/ degree switched. And if your are needing to know what you need to take (class wise) to graduate, dont use the online degree classes lists they have. They havent been updated in 2+ yrs. went to get a waiver (May 17, 2018) for a HLT and ENG class. Turns out I dont need the HLT class. Waste of $400 and waste of an hour being spent in Admin and Records office being belittled by a 'vice principal' and her assistant. Still waiting for the ENG dean and the instructor to sign my ENG waiver (which will take two weeks because of summer break). IF YOUR ADVISOR SAYS THAT THWY CANT DO YOUR WAIVERA FOR YOU, THEY ARE LYING AND BEING LAZY. My new advisor (Ashanti Luke) stated in an email that he/ she cant do the waivers, the deans have to. If the deans do the waivers, then why did the HLT dean office and ENG dean office both tell me that the advisors do the waivers? I see it as laziness. This is your job. Most educatora have contracts that supply thwm thwir job/ career. My tuition (that comes out of my pocket, not FASFA) goes into your paychecks. Do your jobs properly, and then maybe there wouldn't be reviews like this.

review.author: R S.
review.description: When you work with JTCC's Career Switcher program, you are working with thieves.  Their $3,900 program is a waste of time and money.  It's wading through a bunch of BS when you can go simply out and get a teaching job on your own...immediately.  Use the county alternative licensure route (totally free) and skip this racket.  I started with them and quickly got a job in a school on my own.  They wouldn't refund the money because they said that I dropped the class (which I did not, I was removed from it by the obtuse and bumbling "Dr." Missy Ogden).  This is a scam and a waste of money.  What would you expect from a bunch of community college "doctors".  Don't fall into their trap.  Skip it and do it yourself, for free.

review.author: Joe M.
review.description: cool campus. Nice grounds.

review.author: Derick K.
review.description:
I started out with a problem here. Long story short, transitioning to Richmond, Virginia has been a bumpy ride and this particular segment of road was about to set me off. I wanted to register for classes. 

This is a beautiful campus that just pops up driving down Route 1 just passed a Target. Multiple buildings, which take some getting used to and a parking situation that I most certainly will need to figure out are interlaced with sidewalks and, from what I could see, a few summertime students. Counselors have extended hours on Mondays (until 7pm) to accommodate those of us who have to go to work everyday. However, this is on a walk-in basis and by the time I arrived, I had followed a line of people who would be keeping to the two counselors busy for the remainder of the office hours. I sent an email to a director in the counseling department to express my dissatisfaction with what appeared to be an unaccommodating system that not only made it an impossibility to accomplish the necessary preregistration counseling, but really had no valid workaround procedures. 

I was glad that I reached out to get more information. I was directed through a chain of responsible parties until I reached my counselor who obliged to an evening meeting on a day other than Monday (A SCHEDULED APPOINTMENT!!). The counselor got me all squared away and setup and ready to go. To have this stress eliminated is beyond a relief (because of the steps that can start rolling now that this is done). 

I haven't taken a class yet, but what I can hope is that the teachers have the same approach to connecting with the students. That will make this next year a breeze.

review.author: Will J.
review.description: The career fair at John Tyler was the worst. Less than 10 businesses and none worth the effort. Also, John Tyler why have a jobs fair, and you don't have a table representing your college?

review.author: Food Guru H.
review.description: I like both John Tyler Locations but I go to this one because it is closer to my house. I like the diversity of this campus. All of the teachers that I've had were always very good. The campus itself if nice too. They were always willing to help. A nice area to sit outside right in the middle of the campus. The only thing I wish they has was a place to get food within the campus, that would be awesome!

review.author: Patrick D.
review.description: Decent facility, well maintained. Overall a good gym. \n\nThe only reason I didn't rate it higher was because their pricing is pretty high. They do have a good number of gyms in and around Richmond, which makes it nice to catch a workout here or there depending where you might be.

review.author: Lakisha W.
review.description: In the last few months there is more and more equipment that is unavailable for use do to it being out of service. I don't feel that the equipment is up to date and that could be one the  reason that it is constantly breaking down. I pay decent amount of money a month  and to be unable to use certain equipment because it is out of service for weeks at a time is not good. I am really considering changing gyms if things do not approve.

review.author: Chris D.
review.description: scam artists!!!! Push $200 a month trainer  and a $50 a month single membership fee.  Locked in for a year.  feel uncomfortable to come in the place.   Do not do it!!!!!! This place sucks!!!!

review.author: BiCa's B.
review.description:
Zero Stars: Disappointed with American Family Fitness. Charged us automatically for our kids to use the gym for the reopening, I call and reserve (not first time) for my kids and I to swims laps and general manager come in to kick us out and told us no kids cause it's no recreational use. I said we already here and we reserved to do laps, just like before, and I said it at phone call. Then tells my husband, they are treating the whole gym like the kid zone being closed, no one under 9. WHICH WAS NEVER IN THE NEW RULES OR EMAIL FOR REOPENING. Or was brought to us  before when we swam laps.
But then allowed a group of senior citizens women come into our lane at 5:46pm even though we were on the reservation from 5-6pm. They all hung out close together for a Zumba class. THEY looked at MY family like we were wrong for not getting out when they got in.  Done with them, blocking them and I suggest everyone else does.
The nice staff didn't mind my girls and I exercising and swimming laps but general manager wanna make up her own rules and still charge us for the kids. DONT GO TO AMERICAN FAMILY FITNESS THEY DO NOT HONOR FAMILIES PERIOD! We will take our military friends along with us somewhere else and future military friends as well. 
Thank you to the rest of the staff for being so nice to us. 
UPDATE: General Manager refuses to come out and speak to my husband face to face. WHILE my husband was finishing up his workout she sent a staff to post up a sign saying No kids under 8. 
So much for FAMILY fitness.

review.author: Nicara B.
review.description: I joined because of the pool. I used to be a member years ago until i moved away and there was no amfam there. So now I'm back and I'm a little confused. I rejoined not even a week ago. I checked the app this morning to see if they were open. The app said yes. Opened at 5am. So i went. Being a person that doesn't have social media, how was i to know that this is where you post your closures. YOU HAVE A WHOLE APP... shouldn't that be where you post your closures and time changes. That could be for weather or anything. I actually really love this gym. I love the upstairs so i can feel comfortable when I'm ready to die on the machines because I'm out of shape and i don't feel like the entire gym in watching me... but anyway... back to my reason for writing... YOU HAVE A WHOLE ENTIRE APP... i had to get a friend at 5:30am to check social media to see if you posted something about weather... lol.. that's kind of crazy to me... when you HAVE A WHOLE APP that you could have posted on... *breaking weather alert* or anything... come on now... i know it's 2021 but i shouldn't be subject to having social media just to know if my gym is open or not.

review.author: Brad R.
review.description: As a lap swimmer, this gym is horrible. There is no monitoring of loud unruly children (in the kiddie pool) and non-lap swimmers are allowed to dominate the use of the lanes reserved for lap swimmers. \n\nIf you plan on lap swimming, best find another gym.

review.author: Felicia C.
review.description: I miss the sauna and the 24 hour availability. The staff is still nice and attentive.

review.author: Sam C.
review.description: The spring-loaded latch is broken on the cable machine and has been for over a week now. (Added safety issue)\nWhat a failure to properly inspect and identify the cable's frailty (negligence)

review.author: Jennifer W.
review.description: Military should beware of this place. In fact, everyone should. They are the "Family" that takes money and you never see it again. I was lured into joining because I thought the contract was 6 months. It is a year. After about 3 short months, I realized that this gym would not fit into my schedule (yes, it is 24 hours...let me elaborate). I am a single parent (yes! They have childcare...I will get there). By the time I am off of work I get to spend roughly 2.5-3 hours with my kid. I would take him to the gym for about an hour to an hour and a half, but he would cry. He did not really click with any of the caregivers. If he cried for more than 5 minutes, they would come get me. Guess what my 2 year old learned? "If I cry, I get mom." But, that is their "policy." \nI have repeatedly asked out of my contract. I agreed to pay a cancelation fee. Yet, I am charged $68 every month for a gym that feels like the creepy side of the family you are forced to see once a year...They refuse to let me out of my contract because it was for A YEAR...Not 6 months. The ones that took your money and you never saw again. Stick to Golds Gym. MILES cheaper, and great childcare. Or Planet Fitness. Anywhere but here!

review.author: Chris M.
review.description: Friendly amd courteous staff, well maintained facilites and equipment. The only real complaint about this facility is that the monthly price is a bit steep compared to other gyms in the area but with a pool and sauna they have more than the other gyms out here.

review.author: Alex A.
review.description: Staff is awesome and always friendly, equipment is top of the market and there is much variety, and has so many amenities which is amazing for all ages.

review.author: Marissa S.
review.description:
GOT TO BE KIDDING ME!!!

When I signed up here, I explained my situation IN DETAIL.... "My fiancé is in AIT here and we won't be here long enough to fulfill the three yea long membership you're trying to talk me into.... I won't even be here for a YEAR." 

The response?!

"NO WORRIES ma'am!!! As long as you provide us with orders when you leave, we can cancel your membership with no penalty fees!"

After drilling him for THIRTY MINUTES, asking a zillion questions and even calling my fiancé to discuss it, I signed up for a three year family plan......... that's where the problems started. 

I was all gung-ho about this gym, SUPER excited to start my workout. Between having just moved in, my two dogs, doctors appointments (I'm a double amputee) and general responsibilities.... my attendance was lacking. Then we add the car accident I was in and TWO falls, I physically could NOT go (not their fault.... wait for it). The first time I could get there after my fall, they CLOSE the pool 15 minutes after I get there. Which is probably for the best, since it's so disgustingly over chlorinated it made me sick. But REALLY, don't advertise as a 24 Hour gym if you aren't. 

NOW, fiancé got out of the army because of an eye injury that wouldn't heal...... so I've been trying to cancel my membership since NOVEMBER, can someone explain why they're STILL pulling $80 out of my account every month???? I LIVE IN MICHIGAN, wtf am I going to do with a gym membership in VIRGINIA?! 

This place blows, the staff (for the most part) is completely unhelpful, when they're telling the truth. My bank told me they can't block the transactions because I gave them my bank info. LESSON LEARNED!

review.author: Sharon T.
review.description: The staff is attentive and friendly.  They have a large amount of equipment, and have just replaced all the fitness trainers.  There is a full schedule of group fitness, cycle and aquatics classes.  There are many age appropriate activities for kids.  They work hard to keep the facility clean.

review.author: Ralston W.
review.description: Hell you get what you put into it. It has what I need. Just plan your work out time so your not in the crowded hours.

review.author: Bridget D.
review.description: Clean facilities, friendly staff and great class schedules make this a great pick for your gym. Plus so many locations and not many gyms have pools so that's a bonus.

review.author: Stefan S.
review.description:
