I've been a member at this gym for two months and am appalled at their ... well, let me start with the good (this will not take long). American Family Fitness (AFF) is a large facility and filled of high quality equipment.

See, that didn't take long. Now for the bad. The staff at this AFF facility is beyond repair. The front desk, as noted by another review, is typically filled with staff members who, on the surface, appear to be nice but do not bother them when they are busy socializing with one another or with friends / family who come in to talk.

Do you like clean equipment? You will not find it here. I'm amazed that people do not clean the equipment after they use the machines. Wonderful equipment that is literally rusting away due to lack of cleaning. 

Lets talk about the trainers. There are three trainers I've witnessed who do a great job. They work with their clients and provide useful and professional feedback. The rest are not into training you. They are too busy looking around at everyone else but the trainee, they stand with hands in their pockets, but no matter what, you are not their priority.

The members are a unique blend of fit and working out or not fit and just sitting on the equipment in order to look like they are doing something. It's actually funny to watch. There is one guy who does nothing but walks around the gym drinking water. Every once in a while he stretches then talks to other members or staff.

The fitness classes are at odd times and its hard to get in a class that is actually useful, that is, unless you're looking for Zumba or group step but this is truly a subjective category.

What's more? The price is quite high for what the members get. If the professionalism were there, I wouldn't have a problem paying the price.

Overall, the lack of professional staff is what's killing this place. This is a workplace, not a hangout. I gave them two stars because this is a nice facility and filled with great equipment. I subtracted one star for the poor cleanliness of the equipment and removed two stars for the staff's lack of professional behavior. If you don't care about service or a clean facility, you've got an okay place to workout. Otherwise, look elsewhere for a fitness center.

review.author: Sara S.
review.description:
DON NOT TRUST THEY'RE KID ZONE/CHILD WATCH

 We really like the facility, classes and equipment available our issue comes with the Kid Zone. I drop my toddler off for about an hour when we go on a number of occasions I've watched them lead him to a corner hand him a toy and walk away. He then cries because he has been left alone! All the child care attendant stand around the counters talking with not interaction with the kids. Every single time I pick him up he is sitting in a high chair pointed at the tv. I'm gone an hour it's not that hard to entertain a child for that long. 

When I addressed the issue with the director I was basically told I was making everything up and the tv is always on because the kids ask for it. My child doesn't know how to talk yet so I know he did not ask for the tv. On our last visit there when putting him in the car I noticed a significant scratch with blood on the side of his head, when I called and asked about it I was told "he didn't fall I don't know where it came from". For a child that's really calm and easy going he screams and is terrified when I drop him off and we will no longer be trusting our child's safety to them.

review.author: Jordan K.
review.description: Went online to get the free day pass was not able to use it when I showed up. Asked what I had to do to be able to use the facility today, was told that I could not and there was no option of using their fitness center or joining because their membership staff was not there. It looked really cool however when I walked in.

review.author: Starleigh H.
review.description:
I would've given this place a higher rating, but their front desk staff were HORRIBLE at customer service! The 3 girls that were there were friendly & greeted us as we walked in, but they were more concerned with giving each other massages with their little massaging contraption, than to grab us some towels. They were very quick to tell us to see the other chick who was busy making smoothies for other customers.  We must have waited over 5 minutes to try to get someone to help us. Um, NO ONE did! Again, the front desk staff was too busy socializing with themselves, than to take a quick second to help us!

I was so turned off by my initial experience that I can't even give this place a good review! It's unfortunate because it is a very nice, spacious, clean, well-equipped gym.

NOTE TO MANAGEMENT: You might want to rethink who you hire to represent your company! Cause those 3 chicks are not it!

review.author: Trevor S.
review.description:
Gym equipment is adequate but during the time I visited many machines were broken. 

Staff lies about cancellation policies, does not return voicemails, and simply will not allow cancellation of membership. I sent two letters with their required form (which was not discussed at signup). I had to initiate a fraud claim with my bank after wasting dozens of hours of my time trying to cancel my membership after moving out of state.

They made it sound easy and convenient when I signed up. Intentionally deceitful. I would NEVER recommend them to anyone as their corporate office and gym management are irresponsible and lack any ethics.

name: Richard Bland College of William & Mary

review.author: Roshawna W.
review.description: Wish I could give them zero I highly recommend nobody attend this school. For starters screw everyone major up and then make them stay for 3+ years then they overcharge you and try to justify it. Living on campus is the worst part about being there the dorms seems nice but they aren't I can't believe I wasted 2 semesters of my time there. The food there is horrible and unsanitary they don't seem to care they just turn a blind eye. Someone really should investigate that school and shut it down ASAP!! Stay away from there if you value your education and pockets!

review.author: Hans L.
review.description: An excellent, rurally-located school that is a great way to get into William & Mary! You can transfer after you graduate with a 3.25 GPA. They have dorms, athletics, and great faculty. Most courses are taught by full time faculty, not part time or grad students. Super value in VA.

review.author: Lynette C.
review.description: In the early 2000's RBC was an excellent school to attend but since Debbie L. Sydow became president the quality of the school has diminished greatly. She doesn't interact with faculty members or students. A majority of the students have no clue what she looks like because she's never around.  The school doesn't have a medical clinic so when students become ill they have to miss several days of class. The cafeteria has very little choices of food to select from, so a majority of the time your stuck eating unhealthy processed food like chicken tenders and fries everyday. Which gets old really fast. The school store lacks things like toiletries and household supplies so if you don't have a car your out of luck because the nearest store is fifteen miles away. The financial Aid office messed up a lot students funding this semester which left them with out books or meal swipes to eat with. The cafeteria doesn't open until 1:00 on the weekends so you have no way to get breakfast. The library doesn't open at all on Saturdays and until 4:00 on Sunday's. There is absolutely nothing at all to do on campus on the weekends. if you decide to live on campus you will be bored out of your mind. So a majority of the students get drunk or smoke weed. Twenty students were kicked out on the first weekend of school because of it. The school dropped GPA requirements this semester. Which was a big mistake because the quality of the students are trifling and straight rachet. I never saw so many bad weaves in my life!! Freedom Hall reeks of marijuana. The third floor in Patriot Hall smells like feet, onions from bad body odor and weed. Several people have had their property stolen. The housing manager Mr. Scott is never around to rectify the situation but he could careless anyway. He's very nonchalant about his duties as a manager and has no relationship with the students. So if you like to party and never go to class this is the place for you but if you take your education seriously keep looking .

name: Fairbanks North Star Borough School District
Fairbanks North Star Borough School District

review.author: M S.
review.description: Absolutely horrible...My child hated going here. We had huge issues with them.

review.author: Kalie W.
review.description: Wonderful preschool. Could not be more pleased. My son adores Susan and has learned so much from attending. Seeing his enthusiasm about this school has just confirmed that we picked the right place! Your child will learn AND have fun in a safe, clean environment. Susan and her team have all the traits for a well deserved 5 star rating!

review.author: Georgia V.
review.description: I took my granddaughters for an outing and decided to go to paint pottery. I am glad I did.  My five year granddaughter loved it. She would put the first coat on and wanted to paint another ceramic. The ceramic needs at least 3 coats before firing. She put three different colors with multiple designs. I can't wait to see it once it fired. It takes a week. I'll post a picture once it arrives. I decided it would be a great date for my husband and I. I certainly will return.

review.author: Allison C.
review.description: I love painting ceramics so when my daughter wanted a pottery birthday party I was thrilled! They're new location is definitely smaller than their other one in East Brainerd, but it's right off 153, so super easy to get to. They have a ceramic for anything you could imagine and just as many paint colors to choose from. The staff is friendly and extremely helpful. Definitely plan on taking a few hours to spend here and the process can be tedious. \n\nWith regards to their parties... there are room you can reserve (for free) that come with a party host. You're allowed to bring in decorations, food, music, whatever you need to make your party a success. The worst part is having to wait a week to pick up your pieces. I want them now! Will return again and again.

review.author: Misty H.
review.description: The employees are sweet, helpful and knowledgeable. From a large group to a small more intimate night out, we had a relaxing and enjoyable time.

review.author: Allison B.
review.description: I really love this business. I love it even more in its new location. It's such a well laid-out store. The staff is super friendly and helpful. I love that it's really very stress free. We brought our daughter and picked a few items to paint. They have a great collection of stamps stencils sponges an extra tools to help make your project perfect. They have to party rooms which are super cute. Actually hope to have a party there in the near future. It's more expensive then other businesses like this but it's totally worth it. It's fun for all ages. Can't wait to go back at Christmas time as this might be my favorite place for Christmas gifts

review.author: Kevin K.
review.description: I've been swept up by the crafty wave ever since my first visit several years ago. Ever since then, we bring the nieces and nephews whenever they visit. I'm not sure which is the bigger thrill, watching them get into it so enthusiastically or painting ceramics for myself. There is quite a range of ceramic selections to customize. We spend too much of our time trying to pick our dish, vase, tile, animal, character, toy or sport paraphernalia. We get better at the paint and dry cycle every time that we participate. With so many nice little eateries moving in along side it has become the perfect spot for a very engaging date! It's difficult to leave our little treasures there when we're done (the art, not the kids). The week long wait to finally retrieve our kiln fired artifact seems indomitable. (It seems, like forever too!)

review.author: Ellen J.
review.description: This is a really amazing place to pass the time and make amazing pottery art. They have a variety of options to paint and many colors of paint to choose from. They give you everything you need and then it's up to your imagination to make and beautiful piece. The service was perfect and our pieces came out just as we imagined them. This is a great mother-daughter bonding opportunity. I have been here once before my most recent visit and I have enjoyed it both times.

review.author: Natalie Y.
review.description: I can't ever express how much I loved this place. Had my daughter's birthday party here. Not only is this a great not too expensive place for a kid's birthday it's also unique and fun. Booking was very simple. Kids choose which "figure" they want to paint and it actually takes longer than I thought it would which was perfect because kids were busy. They also make a special gift for the birthday kid which is a plate with birthday kid's hand print and guests (kids) get to do their finger print on that plate which is amazing for the memory. Staff is super helpful and polite. We forgot candles and a lighter and they provided that for us not to ruin the birthday cake. Overall, very much would recommend this place.

name: Fairbanks North Star Borough School District

review.author: Ann J.
review.description: Formerly the Arts & Education Council, this non-profit has been in exsitence since 1952.  The mission statement is:  "Southern Lit Allliance celebrates Southern writers and readers through community education and innovative literary arts experiences".  Programs include:  Dramas for Youth;  Young Southern Student Writers Awards; and the Celebration of Southern Lit Alliance.  Check it out at www.SouthernLitAlliance.org.

review.author: Theresa E.
review.description: This campus is absolutely gorgeous. Taking a moment of your day to visit it is so worth it. If you like architecture. Gardens. And history. This place is beautiful. And unexpected. I enjoyed it walking the campus and enjoying the beautiful spaces.

review.author: Shannon S.
review.description: Sewanee: The University of the South is a beautiful place and I really enjoy visiting here just to enjoy the scenery along with attending events ranging from music to athletics etc.  I had several friends that attended this fine university and I also got to play for the Sewanee rugby team on a few occasions but then again I got to play for the rugby teams of a whole lot of schools back in the day when such things were not so controlled as they are now.  I went to Ole Miss (back when it was Ole Miss) and a guy from the Ole Miss rugby team helped start Sewanee's rugby team back in the day so there is a connection between Ole Miss and Sewanee's rugby team going back to that point.  This is a very special and unique place with exceptional traditions and they certainly know how to study hard along with having a really fun time.

review.author: Kathy V.
review.description: I recently stayed at a house that is located on the Sewanee campus. The grounds are absolutely gorgeous!

review.author: Nancy G.
review.description:
I have been cooking and taking cooking classes just about everywhere for the past 30 years. I highly recommend taking classes here. 

I took the beginning culinary 12 week course and learned so many new skills and tidbits from Chef James!   He is so knowledgeable and the classes are very interactive and fun!

Caitlin Rose, who greets you at the front desk, is So very kind and helpful. The entire support staff is amazing.

I will be taking other workshops there in the very near future!

So fun! Thank you Culinary Lab Team!

review.author: Amber B.
review.description: CulinaryLab is a fun place to learn more about cooking. The bread baking workshop I took was very organized and fun.\nMy instructor was thorough and knowledgeable. It was fun to learn in a commercial kitchen and having the dishwashing crew was a treat! \nAll of the items I made were delicious, and there was enough to share with the whole fam

review.author: David M.
review.description:
The wife bought me a gift certificate for this place.  Used the first half on the knife skills class.  
Good instructor, excellent support staff walking around during course to help, and great setup with the layout and TV monitors showing instructors work area.
This class concentrates on vegetables which makes sense.  Allows for a lot of varied cutting/slicing techniques.  All of this work goes into making a salad that you also get to eat!
Class covered types of knives and how to sharpen and care for them.
Can't wait for their sauces course!!

review.author: Tara T.
review.description: I am a homecook and I took Pasta Bootcamp at Culinery Lab in Tustin.  I had  excellent experience, learning new skills and science behind using certain  ingrediants. \n\nChef T and Assistent Chef Omar were excellent. They were able to accomodate my special vegetarian diet requirents.  Chef Omar was very helpful in suggesting alternative ingrediants for recipes. I would love to go back for more vegeterian friendly classes.

review.author: Adriana M.
review.description:
I just took the Artisan bread boot camp and loved it! I'm already a professional baker with a culinary school background but wanted to learn new techniques and let me tell you the two-day boot camp was amazing! The difficulty level was great, even for the ones who were making bread for the first time. 
The chef instructor was very professional and explained everything so clearly. The kitchen had excellent equipment and tools (professional grade).
The recipes that they gave us were gourmet, but very easy to recreate at home.
I already booked another boot camp and a workshop, I can't wait!

Would recommend 100%

review.author: Cindy N.
review.description: Such a fantastic experience taking my first course at the Culinary Lab! The Plant-based Boot Camp was just what I needed to feel more confident and creative preparing vegan meals. Chef TC was amazing! He taught us the science behind different cooking practices and even shared knife skills and other tips to make us as successful as we possibly could be. All the staff are so detail oriented and generous with their knowledge and expertise. It is very apparent that they love what they do and that they are well trained and appreciated. Looking forward to learning and experiencing more at the Culinary Lab soon.

review.author: Jamie G.
review.description: I had the best experience here working with Chef Jamie on the beginner's Home Cook 12-week series. Knife skills, sauces, killing a lobster, French fries from scratch - we covered all these basics and so much more. Every day we ate our creations and had plenty to bring home, along with all recipes. The staff in the kitchen assisted with expertise; students never had to wash a single dish. Accommodations were made to reschedule if you missed a week here or there and staff was always friendly and professional. The herb garden outside was awesome for seasoning and plating our dishes. Can't say enough great things!

review.author: Elena M.
review.description: Best quality cooking class I've found here in Orange county. I took a beginner course and got useful knowledge out of it. It was fun and really tasty as well. Thank you.

review.author: Greg W.
review.description:
My wife and I just completed the plant-based cooking class Boot Camp. I'm trying to eat healthier, but my primitive creations are sometimes lacking, derided as "swamp water" by my sons. This "boot camp", packed with great information and aptly named, will help me up my game. 

Our instructor was extremely knowledgeable and an accomplished chef. The staff was very helpful and supportive and on hand to assist if we ever got stuck or needed help. (Also, they had guys washing dishes, cleaning up, after each round of cooking, which was nice.)

This class taught me a lot about various techniques and and options, including tons of tips that I can use every day. I learned how to make some new healthy dishes that I can cook that actually taste good. 

Also, the setting is great, quality steel tables, stoves, knives etc, lots of good utensils and all types of equipment. I have more confidence in using appliances that have been sitting on a shelf in my house, learned how to make sauces, purées and creamy soups (without the cream), as well as some fundamentals about chopping, seasoning, order of adding ingredients.

The boot camp is intense and packed with content, so be prepared for an immersive experience, but it's is broken up with breaks where you get to eat what you cooked. Fun to meet, work with and eat with other class members. Ended up with lots of good leftovers and piles of take home containers. The dishes and recipes covered the gamut. I liked most of them, didn't like a few, but overall great place and great experience.

review.author: Ray L.
review.description: Completed the Holiday bootcamp this past week and I really enjoyed the two-day bootcamp. The food we cooked was delicious and being able to cook in a kitchen with the proper tools was great. The intructor, Chef James, was also pleasant and helpful too. \n\nI would definitely find more classes to learn from here!!

review.author: The Joker I.
review.description:
I've learned so much from this school.  I've rediscovered how much I enjoy cooking (although I wasn't very good at it then) during the early pandemic in 2020 and found this school to help me reliably cook food that I would proudly serve to others.  It's given me that and more.  I've learned TONS here and have made all the things I've ever wanted to and then some (French onion soup, fish and chips from scratch, pastas from scratch, eclairs, creme brûlée's).  

The school is legit and the vibe is very friendly and welcoming.  

Learning to cook takes time and practice. This school helped demystify it for me.  I get a lot of compliments on the food I make now which makes me happy.  And I have drastically reduced buying food from restaurants now.  Would definitely recommend.

Special shout out to Caitlin and Sarah.  :)

review.author: Betty H.
review.description: Took a sample dessert cooking class here. Super nice staff. The facility was new and clean. We got to bake a bit and eat our creations. Really fun. I would return here to take more classes. \nIn another life, I would be a pastry chef. ha.

review.author: Jeff H.
review.description: Great class, fun, well paced, helpful and informative, learning kitchen was well stocked. Our Chef was great.

review.author: Melanie R.
review.description: Culinary Lab not only prepares you for cooking/pastry, it can also prepare you to work IN the industry with its Apprenticeship Program or prepare you to run your own buisness with its Entrepreneurship Program! I have learned so much valuable information from both programs, but the Entreprenurship Program has made me feel like my dream to own/run a reataurant is more acheivable. Currently the program is one day every other week, for five hours. There is no "fluff", just valuable information, making my trips from San Diego well worth it. Having gone through its Culinary, Apprenticeship, and Entrepreneurship programs, I can confidently say that this school is built to make sure you succeed! And with 0% financing, why would you choose another school?

review.author: Ronnie F.
review.description: This is my 5th class with CulinaryLab Cooking School.  We did the French Macaron class, and it was so much fun.  We learned Caramel, Ganache and Italian Macaron Method, and now I see why they are so expensive when you purchase them at the bakery.  Lovely company, Chef Natalie is always available for help during the class, and the other students all had fun.  Thanks again, and I will be back.

review.author: Paulina O.
review.description: Just completed the Instant Pot + Sous Vide Boot Camp and not only did I have so much fun, but I learned so much. Chef Lauren was wonderful as well as all the staff at CulinaryLab. They were all so sweet and so helpful. \n\nI don't consider myself a good cook and was nervous about keeping up in the class, but I was so comfortable and everything was demonstrated so well. It was such a great experience and I can't wait to return for their 12 week beginner's course.

review.author: Marian K.
review.description: I searched the internet for a baking class and saw Culinary Lab. I enrolled in the Laminated Dough Boot Camp last March 2020. I was so impressed with the Chef Instructors, the facility, the method of teaching and the over all course itself. I learned a lot, baked a lot and ate a lot! I am even thinking what I learned could be a good side gig during my retirement! The office/kitchen crew were so helpful, Warm and friendly and they made me feel so welcome. I can't wait for my next course!

review.author: Seanise H.
review.description: I'm reluctant to give this review because my experience has been so mixed. I took the 12 week beginner cooking course and LOVED IT. I enjoyed it so much I signed up for other classes. One of the classes I signed up for was the two day bread class ($550). I make bread at home all the time but thought the class could help me level up my skills... 1am the morning of the class my mother called me to inform me my step dad passed away from Covid... I immediately booked a flight to go home to be with my family for 7 am that morning. I emailed culinary lab to let them know I wouldn't be making it. A week later I reached back out to reschedule my class to the next one a few months later and they informed me I couldn't reschedule or be reimbursed. I understand why normally last minute cancelations can't be refunded because food is purchases and can't be used but this was a bread class... flour salt water and sugar are not meats and fresh veggies that will go bad. I sent them proof that I had booked my flight at 1am that morning and even offered to give them a death certificate to prove it was an emergency.... They were unwilling to accommodate... out of frustration I cancelled all the other classes I had booked.

review.author: Janet S.
review.description: I absolutely loved my home cooking class. The chef was thorough with the instructions and process. I gain so much knowledge about how to prepare meats and vegetables. I learned how to make sauces, cut and cook fish and so many other things. The best thing is the confidence I gained in my own kitchen.  Loved, loved loved it. Already signed up for more classes.

review.author: April L.
review.description: This is for the pilot Entrepreneurship program which has been very enlightening. I would recommend the program for those serious about starting their own food related business. It's a lot of hard work but worth it.

review.author: Spencer A.
review.description: So far I have purchased 2 properties with Warren of Jack White Realty. I cannot say enough good things about Warren. He was very communicative, above board, upfront, and a professional willing to go the extra for a customer - like physically driving to a property in your staid to verify a question or concern. \n\nA good realtor is like a good mechanic, you only use them.

review.author: Dwain C.
review.description: I went to the Skagway School District in Skagway, Alaska on 8/15/2014.  I was hoping to buy a school shirt or cap.  I was able to get a Skagway Panthers hoodie.  Friendly staff.

review.author: Jordan S.
review.description: Was recruited by the golf coach to not only play but come for The Professional Golf Course Management class the supposedly had. Well after a couple weeks of attending classes and getting asked by the professors what I am here for and telling them about golf course management, they said that course ended a couple years ago. So I was lied to, and then was never given proper help for the classes I was now thrown into and was never even helped financially from the school financial aid system. I would recommend to not attend this school, but that's just my personal opinion

review.author: Joseph L.
review.description: I was struggling with physics; unable to even break a C at school. After the help of the physics tutor from CalTech, I was soon excelling in topics such as Optics, Quantum Mechanics, and Electromagnetism.\nLater, I started counseling, and Advance Academy helped me find multiple extra-curricular activities that I would have never been able to find myself, even with the help of a school counselor.\nOverall, I am glad that I found such a wonderful place that has been able to help develop my comprehensive education.

review.author: Amy L.
review.description: Great staff! They were really helpful and gave me a lot of advice on improving school work and plans for college. I would definitely recommend this place for tutoring or high school students who need guidance for college planning.

review.author: Bob B.
review.description: Advance Academy was the place i sent my kid to. It surprised me by how great this place was. My son has received an amazing score. I would definitely recommend Advance Academy to any student! The place has a friendly environment with great teachers!

review.author: Anahi R.
review.description: My little one love going to school , everyone is very nice and polite. I could say they are very friendly and love each student who goes there. I do recommend sunflower preschool all the teachers are very sweet, Mrs.Jass , Mrs Vanesa. And all the other teachers too.

review.author: Angelic P.
review.description: I totally recommend this place. My son has been coming here since he was 2 years old. He is now 4 1/2 and loves it here. Breakfast, lunch, dinner & snacks are served daily. All the teachers are really nice and hands on. They have a great routine going on and the rates are the lowest you'll find around the area. You can feel safe leaving your child here. They have cameras everywhere.

review.author: Alee G.
review.description: I really enjoyed being toured at this school. I came to check prices and see the atmosphere for my niece to come. The director was very attentive when I came in and answered all my questions. I really appreciated how on top she was with the teachers and children even though she was answering my questions. This school is definitely on  the top of list to bring my niece.

review.author: Rafael G.
review.description: My niece goes to this school.  I have been there a few times and she totally loves it. She has been there since she was three. She graduated kinder and is now in after school care.  She absolutely loves it! The summer time is really fun!  There are many activities for the children and the staff is really caring.  I highly recommend this school! Did I mention that tutoring for her homework is included?

review.author: Pam M.
Maggie B.
review.description: The prices are very affordable but not a place where your kids will do much learning. I had my girls there for 3 days and didn't take them back. One of their rooms smell like pee, might be because some kids are in the process of potty training but I'm sure they can have someone clean the carpets. I went in to pick up my girls various times in those 3 days, never were they being taught anything. It was just ladies just watching the kids do their own thing. Wouldn't recommend this daycare if you're trying to help your kid learn something. Oh and looked like they get the same snack everyday. When I walked in one morning the kids were eating gold fishes and peaches i don't know if that was their breakfast or their snack, this was at 8am.

review.author: Tracy S.
review.description: My son started preschool last week, (my son is two). I am pleased with his teacher ... and the small class size. Most reasonable place that I could find in Orange County.  Healthy  food is served (breakfast,snacks,lunch etc) and included. What is really great is they potty train, and the school is very clean and well organized.

review.author: Claudia E.
review.description: I dont even know where to start this is such a great school with great teachers that truly care for the children.  My oldest was fully potty trained within a month of coming here!!!!! After two years of coming here she doesn't want to leave and is sad because she has to move on to a big girl school. My little one started coming October 2015 when she turned 2 and i have seen huge improvements in her developmental delays especially her speech and socializing. I can continue with all the positives.....overall i do recommend

review.author: Michelle G.
review.description: I love this school the teachers care about the children and lunches are great and nutritious  the children are always busy

review.author: Elizabeth S.
review.description: I love this school my 3year old son started school in July of 2016 and he's learned a lot and been potty trained I like that the teachers get one on one with every student thank you to all your teachers sunflower pre school I appreciate all your hard work to take care of my son feel very safe with this school

review.author: Michelle R.
review.description: Can't stress on how pleased I am with this school. My son started coming here as a 2 1/2 and will be turning 4 in June. He's learned so much within that time frame. Not to mentioned they potty trained him in within a month! I love how all the teachers are super detailed with the little ones, they literally know them ALL by names! I wouldn't switch my son to another preschool. I'm beyond satisfied with the services & education they provide!

review.author: Josie E.
review.description: Please dont come here if you are a cash customer (which is the only way to get a receipt by the way) they dont account you for what you pay and put a different amount on the receipt. I went through this and am so glad i no longer have to deal with it!!!!

review.author: Joy Z.
review.description: I have been taking my 2 kids to daycare for a little over a year. I love this place my kids have learned so much. Not only do they have great teachers but their activities are awesome.They care for every single student that is there.   They serve great healthy lunch and snacks.I would definitely recommend this daycare/preschool.  My kids love this place they dont want to stop going there.

review.author: Jenn G.
review.description: Where to begin...This area is not the best  area in Santa Ana, with high traffic during morning and afternoon hours. Parking is a real problem with this school. Allow yourself enough time to park and wait to be allowed out of the parking lot. You will get trapped in a parking space until an inconsiderate parent that decided to park behind you or outside of the parking stall comes back and decides it's finally time to leave. (If you know you will be in the school for longer than just a few minutes to drop off/pick up your child, don't be an idiot and park where you won't let other parents out.) There are only about 8 parking stalls and some parents will take up two stalls or simply decide not to use them and park behind other cars. This happens every single day. Oh yeah and as another parent mentioned before, if you are a cash customer, you don't get a receipt for your payment right away. You wait a day or two which has been a problem for me once before. Fortunately it was not a large amount that was unaccounted for so I let it go. Tip: pay the exact amount and pay on time. Other than that, the teachers are really sweet.

review.author: Tina W.
review.description: As always very professional very kind and very informative about all their product lines amazing customer service with a beautiful face and smile behind it all thank you for yesterday I really appreciated it and I needed this experience\nT.Waage\nBungalo hair lounge

review.author: Amy C.
review.description: Heather and all the employees are always so helpful and knowledgeable. Always top service, thank you guys!!

review.author: Jen C.
review.description: Bought 22inches and 18inches in the tape Aug 4th 2021 today when I got them moved up they were ripping apart. These are the worst extensions I've ever had and not ever 3 months and they are shredding. When I bought them they told me to just use the conditioner they sell and I bought it. Was not told "apparently" I have to use a specific brand of shampoo... so it's apparently my fault they sold me default hair. They offered me 15% off my next set. When would I spend another grand on hair that didn't even last 3 months.!!!! That's absurd!!!!

review.author: Mandy W.
review.description: I went there a few months back.. I was assisted in getting new extensions. My hair is platinum.  When I went in I had it up in a bun where it apparently appeared darker.  I bought 2 1/2 packs of tape 20 inch. When I got to my salon..., they were Completely yellow ashy super dark. Did not match my hair at all.. since I opened it I couldn't return. I dealt with the hair  for at least a month... I had to trim at least 4 inches off   They got super stringy at the ends. And felt like crap.  I'm disappointed. I got talked into this brand instead of hair shop.  And the hair didn't last a month. nor did it ever match.  it's cheaper price and quality. \n\nI'm a hairstylist and will not purchase again.

review.author: Rimma A.
review.description: Love beauty solutions! Love Kevin Murphy!\nLove Heather! Makes it worth my while driving 25 miles out of my way. The sweetest most professional and representing the brand. Thank you Heather for always going out of your way to make me feel welcome!

review.author: Elizabeth S.
review.description: Amazing staff, so friendly and helpful any time I have called or went into store. The reps and educators are so knowledgeable. I recommend taking as many classes through beauty solutions as possible. They have so much knowledge and insight that can be so amazing for stylists. It really has helped me through COVID-19 to take advantage of the online help they offer as well. Thank you to all the ladies at beauty solutions OC!!!

review.author: Liz L.
review.description: I love Beauty Solutions! Everyone is so helpful and sweet! I come here every chance I get. I love the classes they provide with the membership too!

review.author: Michael M.
review.description: A friendly and knowledgeable staff!  They are very accommodating and always a pleasure to work with!

review.author: Pheenix P.
review.description: First of all, the shop is always immaculate. Never ever have I seen boxes piled up or even seen them restocking but somehow they are always fully stocked!! It's a miracle for a beauty supply to be like this. Second, Heather is an amazing asset to this company! She ALWAYS helps me when I ask her multiple questions, she is so patient and always so nice. She looks presentable and chic and obviously runs an efficient team! I always look forward to my visit to the shop. Give Heather a huge raise, she deserves it!

review.author: Shelby F.
review.description: It's always a treat going to the oc resource center! The ladies working are always so helpful with the different brands they have in the store. The also have great classes for stylist, I'm looking forward to the new Scottsdale and San Jose center that will be up in 2020!

review.author: Taylor D.
review.description: Love this salon! Very fair priced good quality extensions. \nI got the sunset brand 18' extensions

name: Maska - Mikhailik Architectural Studio for Kids and Adults

review.author: Marie V.
review.description: My son (who is 11) takes a class with Natalia, and he loves it. When I was looking for art classes, I only found places that had children do very realistic work (often mostly tracing at first), but I wanted to find a class where his creative side would be stimulated. Since he also loves building things, this class is great for him as it combines the best of both worlds, art and architecture. Whether or not your child is interested in architecture, he or she will enjoy the kinds of assignments Natalia makes them do, which appeal to girls and boys alike and have them produce colorful, beautiful, and original work. What my son likes most is that he is encouraged to use his imagination in a way he never gets to during art classes at school.  We're always amazed at what he brings home. Natalia is great with children of all ages and really encourages my son to do his best. I highly recommend this studio! We gladly drive half an hour to get to this studio every week. Check out their Facebook page or website and you will see the great things children do. They also have classes for older, middle-school aged children that are more directly related to architecture.

name: Kumon Math and Reading Center of Santa Ana - South Coast Metro

review.author: Janet F.
review.description:
I have been coming to this kumon center for the last 4 years. We started because in kindergarten I realized my child was already behind in reading. The progress was really slow in the beginning but by the end of the school year he had caught up & by first grade he surpassed his peers. He is currently in 3rd grade & reads at a 7th grade reading level & can read 169 words in a minute. Not only does he read well but more importantly he understands/comprehends what he is reading. He switched from reading to math in 2nd grade & he is completing 4th grade math currently. 

My other son has been doing kumon for 1.5 yrs & just started kindergarten. He took a reading test recently at school & he is already reading at a 1st grade reading level. I think his reading will skyrocket now that he is getting formal instruction in school plus continuing kumon. He is already much more advanced than my first son at the same age because I enrolled him in kumon sooner. I wanted him to be prepared to start school (not like my experience with my first son). 

Let me say that there is no magic to this system and your results will not come overnight. It takes time, commitment, & patience. Kumon provides structure & accountability for both you & your child. As some have said the staff are young but they are capable of helping your child if they need it. It's like hiring a high school honors kid to tutor your child, but the point of the program is to get your child to the point they don't need so much help. My family has had a great experience with this kumon center. If your child is behind, kumon will get them caught up. If your child is advanced, kumon can challenge them. If you want your child to "get ahead", kumon can do that too!

review.author: Marisol S.
review.description: I enrolled my niece in Kumon for about 2 1/2 years and I had the most terrible experience. To be candid, there was no clear communication on improvement levels. The staff would give blinding reports that indicated my niece was performing at a higher level. However, I realized that was not the case after she received state exam reports that were way below the reports of Kumon. I understand that a simply tutoring program will not be enough. But as a working mother who struggles financially, I am disappointed with the results and how the situation was handled when I brought the issue to light. I would recommend looking at different places.

review.author: Gigi A.
review.description:
I came here because my 8 year old is a gifted student and i wanted to take him to the next level in math. It is basically a place where they give your kids Math or English Worksheets/Booklets. If you are able to buy the Kumon workbooks and just have your child do them at home then save yourself the time, money and commute. 

They basically have your child sit at a desk and do the worksheets. If they need help they ask one of the teenaged assistants to help. The teenagers come and help for a minute and then leave them alone again. The assistants are very young and don't seem to have any educational training on how to mentor kids or tutor them with positive encouragement/reinforcement. They just come along and correct the child's mistake with a very bored attitude like someone being forced to help their younger sibling with homework. 

The owner was nice till she got me to sign up then she became rude and impatient. She also asked me to pay by cash which I did but found strange. I explained that the teenager who was helping my child was really cold and corrected my child in a shaming way so instead of having a word with her teenage assistant and suggesting alternative methods she told me off and insulted me in front of other parents. Stay away or if you like the drilling style of math then check out the other locations for the program.

review.author: JayJay C.
review.description: worst place ever stay away they need to take the pictures down they do not look nothing like the pictures not that professional just a bunch of young teenagers who aren't even grown to tutor and be able to understand what's child development when them themselves are kids. waste of money they don't help they rush and don't give your children that full attention when they. have two kids at once save ur money and tutor your children at home

review.author: B M.
review.description: If I could give zero stars I would. I think that sums it up. Dirty, bad communication, overcrowded, etc. I have Been trying to unenroll my child for two weeks and still unable to get a human being on the phone. Perhaps the kumon concept is okay but this place is horrid. Do not send your kids to this kumon.

review.author: Lisa M.
review.description: Both my girls completed elementary at Greenville in 2014 and 2018. School was great, office staff great, great teachers and awesome PFO. Love how involved all the parents were. My husband loved the father daughter dance. My girls went to Astro Camp 5th grade year they loved it. Loved that the cost to attend Astro Camp was reasonable and we were able to raise funds through PFO to help parents offset some of the expense to attend Astro Camp. Overall awesome experience at Greenville! My only one wish is that they come up with a better system for picking up students cause the line can be ridiculous!

review.author: Lynae D.
review.description:
I signed up my son and reserved his spot for when they were still under construction. At the time, it was supposed to open well in advance prior to when I needed to head back to work after my maternity leave ended. As I continued to drive by the facility, I noticed it didn't look near complete. I reached out in January since I hadn't heard anything (son was supposed to start in February) and that's when they told me their opening was delayed with no ETA on completion. I completely understand construction being delayed, however I would have appreciated a courtesy e-mail letting me know about the delay so I could start finding alternatives. Parents of infants know how hard it is to find availability for infants and the long waitlists...It wasn't going to open in time for my return to work, so I had to find another daycare.

I had reached out regarding a refund for my deposit since it wasn't my fault that I wasn't enrolling. I received no response, then I got told the director had already changed. The new director responded and let me know she would look into it. She also suggested I just hold onto it if I wanted to enroll him at a later date. We were VERY happy with our current daycare and the lack of communication is what concerned me already. I would have explored them as an option for pre-school, but I never received another follow-up e-mail and wrote several different times. I also called in and left messages and never heard back. I eventually gave up and never received my deposit back.

It's unfortunate because we live so close, but if their lack of communication and transparency is already a concern...to me it displays their business values and communication is key to me when I'm choosing care for my kids.

review.author: Nancy V.
review.description: Kiddie Academy of Santa Ana is great I love the staff Ms. Alanna was really helpful & caring when I sign up my son. My son completed the program with his two amazing teachers Mrs. Yovana who had the patience with him since day one she so sweet, also Ms. Karla she was so nice. They were both wonderful with my son. Best part was they have cameras...It made me feel comfortable leaving my son because I would get to monitor him 24/7. Overall the staff was really friendly highly recommend.

review.author: Mary Claire R.
review.description: Very secure preschool and friendly management. It is very easy to request for extra care for my daughter. Very thoughtful teachers. Good meals too. Very recommended!

review.author: Rebecca S.
review.description: I rarely give any reviews but I wouldn't miss the opportunity to say how amazing Kiddie Academy of Santa Ana has/is to our family. My daughter just completed the program and is moving on to TK and I wouldn't be more pleased on how this center helped my daughter come out of her shell. Ms. Alanna and her staff are the best. I would highly recommend Kiddie Academy of Santa Ana

review.author: Thuy K.
review.description: My daughter has been coming to this daycare for over 2 years now. The teachers are absolutely genuine and very attentive with the children. I felt at peace going to work leaving my daughter here while still being able to monitor her from time to time. I appreciate all the staff as they are so friendly.

review.author: Jessica C.
review.description:
BEWARE PARENTS!!! Horrible management, inflexible policies, doesn't care about the kids or families, and questionable care. They don't care about your kids, only about collecting their money. Yes they may have all the bells and whistles but it's a facade to distract you from the soullessness of this place. 

My son was there for a year and during that time it was a revolving door of teachers. Any of the good teachers that were there always left after a short time being there for a better job that paid more somewhere else. Kids need consistency and leadership, this was nowhere to be found in this place. 

When I picked him up, on multiple occasions I witnessed kids watching an iPad in the corner while the teachers cleaned up the classroom. This was also intentionally done outside view of the cameras so parents couldn't see. SHADY!! Also, no singing, reading, circle time, or any of the "educational" related activities they dupe parents into thinking they provide. 

It was so bad at one point they didn't have any toys or books in the class, until I brought it to the attention of management. The teachers (or lack there of) had all the bookcases that we're supposed to be filled with toys and activities to play with emptied and turned facing the wall. This was only slightly remedied when I brought it to the attention of management. Really?!? How did they not see it before?? Shameful. 

Then on top of it all, my son stopped going there when the pandemic started, we paid for a whole week he didn't go. We took the opportunity to get him out of that school and never look back. We asked for our deposit plus the week we paid and he didn't go back and they said they couldn't give it to us!! They even had the audacity to suggest we "transfer it to another family so they can use it and give us the money directly"... uhhh what kind of legitimate business would ever suggest something so ridiculous?!? Bottom line, it's a deposit, your supposed to give it back. We need our money back, especially during a hard time right now for so many families. We told them this and they couldn't care less. They were so insensitive it was despicable. 

Bottom line, this place is TERRIBLE!!! DO NOT SEND YOUR KIDS HERE EVER!! They don't care about you or your kids and the care is questionable. Take my experience as a warning and keep looking for a better place! It's out there. After we left this place, we found one that's WAY BETTER and CHEAPER where teachers actually care about the kids and they do sooo many fun activities all the time.

review.author: Tiffany C.
review.description: I have been searching for the right preschool for my 2.5 year old. I thought it would be hard for my son to transition from an in home babysitter, but it's been amazing! It's been over 2 months now and I am happy to say I made the right choice. He attends five full days a week and loves to talk about school and the awesome playground. \nThe teachers and staff are professional, dependable and very caring towards all the kids. They make it a point to know you personally and gives me the peace of mind I need while I am at work.  In addition, the facility is beautiful, well maintained and secure.  Bonus: The parking lot spaces are big and always available.  I am so excited to watch my son grow at this school.

review.author: Stephanie P.
review.description: I absolutely love Kiddie Academy of Santa Ana! Mind you, this is only my second daycare (the first being Kiddie Academy of Tustin) but I feel really comfortable with the infant room here. Being a first time mom who suffers from anxiety, I have really struggled to trust anyone with my daughter. After some minor panic attacks while learning to adjust, I've gotten really comfortable with the teachers and office personnel. Justine really seems to understand my daughter's moods and recognizes when she just isn't being herself... that's big when you are dealing with an infant. I like that someone else is able to recognize a problem and tell me. She's confirmed my suspicion of my daughter being slightly off and we found out she had an ear infection. Gemma is just the sweetest, you can tell that she has a lot of experience with kids. Its reassuring to know someone is showing her affection throughout the day, she really thrives on it. I worry slightly less knowing these ladies are watching my little girl. One of my most favoritest things is the pictures and videos they send me on the Tadpole app. I get probably one or more a day, which definitely brightens my day. They understand the small things really matter. For mothers day, there were so many cute little things my daughter was involved in... it wouldn't have been possible without these wonderful teachers and I will treasure the gifts forever. When it comes to my view on how my daughter does here versus the other Kiddie Academy, I would say she does so much better here... she is thriving. It's just amazing for her development, the room is wide open with lots of things that interest her. I'm so glad we found this daycare, I definitely recommend Kiddie Academy of Santa Ana!

review.author: Jasmine A.
review.description: This is the first day care for both of my kids & they have been adjusting very well , I love that they send you an email every single day of what they had for snack & lunch . Also it makes me feel confident in leaving them there while I'm at work everything it's gated & they have a lock pin before entering its so awesome if you don't know the code you can't get in , the teachers seem to be very friendly & very patient totally recommend it .

review.author: Renee L.
review.description: This day care center is great! Everything is so new and clean, the staff is super friendly and professional, and the location is really convenient.

review.author: Gianna T.
review.description: We love Anna and the math curriculum at Mathnasium! We've been there for over a year and enjoy it so much. My daughter has fun and is learning a ton. Thank you for the love and attention you give the kids!

review.author: Sanam F.
review.description: I am so happy that we decided to try out this location. Just since June my daughters math has improved significantly. Anna and her team are wonderful. They truly care about the students and are always willing to go the extra mile. I would recommend this location 100 times over.

review.author: Logan O.
review.description: Mathnasium is an amazing tutoring center! I came in for a free tryout for calculus and loved the way the tutors interacted with me and helped me understand the material after a few years of not having math. I could have not been able to pass my class without their help and i would recommend this place to anyone. The atmosphere is great, they are flexible with scheduling, tutors really know the material. High praises all around. Thank you for helping me succeed in my calculus class.

review.author: Gigi L.
review.description: Very happy with this business. The new owner is so nice and accommodating. The teachers are the best. I really suggest this particular mathematics coaching establishment.

review.author: Vanessa M.
review.description: We visited two other Mathnasiums and chose this branch for a few reasons. First, I noticed during the trial/first class that Anna and the instructor who was teaching my son did so with kindness. Second, I appreciate the positivity that is used during his lessons. Anna is really good at communicating the progress that is happening in class with your child. You'll love this branch and especially Anna the owner.

review.author: Mau F.
review.description: My daughter has been going to the North Costa Mesa Mathnasium center for almost half year now and she has improved her math understanding exponentially. Anne and her staff are great teachers and very patient and understanding. My daughter is taking AP calculus and the team has really going the extra mile to help her. But it is not only the tutoring, they genuinely care for the students. I recommend this center to anyone that is looking for math help and good educators. Big thanks to Anne and her team,   We really appreciate their effort and help.

review.author: Stephanie B.
review.description: My daughter has been attending Mathnasium for a year now. She has improved so much because the staff there have been very patient with her and aligning the work for her in her pace. The school have noticed her progress and we could not be more than proud of her. If your child is struggling with math, try this Mathnasium! We are online with them currently and the effort in online teaching is the same as if she was inside the building! Thank you!

review.author: David M.
review.description: Excellent teachers. I've had 3 kids graduate from there and working on a 4th. Go purple Panthers!!!

review.author: Lois B.
review.description: We'd heard of MARC from fellow aviators, so arranged to stop by (via road - not wings) while on vacation.  The receptionist was very generous with her time and cheerfully gave us a tour during which she explained the history and current objectives of MARC.  She introduced us to team members as we walked thru the various areas.  Staff and volunteers were all very friendly and happy to answer our questions.

review.author: Maikel C.
review.description: my dog didnt eat my fish so i ate it but then my dogish came back to life with canes in a box eating chick fil a in my couch playing fortnite in warzone

review.author: Bri M.
review.description: They kept messing up my summer classes and I could've graduated on time but no I had to everything at the last minute and I did good I never got in trouble. There were students who cheated their way to graduation lol.

review.author: Sandra F.
review.description: Beautiful venue but there is no way to watch the game from behind the brick wall! Bleachers are low and have no clear view of right, left or batters box. The only clear view is to stand behind the tall brick wall (short people can't see). Who designed this field? It was very disappointing.

review.author: Mui K.
review.description: They used to hold church events here on Sunday.  They sale good fry wonton shrimp here.  I wonder where they hold this church events now.

review.author: David M.
review.description: Great little college campus right on the river. Very friendly place to go to school.

review.author: Jordan M.
review.description: Great video upstairs about salmon and the proposed dam site that would be devastating to the progress of phasing out the traditional hydro dam practices.

review.author: Melinda M.
review.description: I walked in to get information on salmon viewing areas and the lady at the front desk was relay nice.m offering a lot more information about the area. They offer free river walks and have aquariums and play free movies. Cute store dedicated to salmon in a cute area!

review.author: Lisa N.
review.description: I used to fly with Don when I visited Alaska on both floats and skies (season dependent). And I still recommend him and Alaska Floats and Skis today. This place is awesome.

review.author: Greg C.
review.description:
Alaska Floats & Ski is the real deal. From the minute you reach out, there is an eager and accommodating person ready to help you. Meredith makes you feel so welcome when you first arrive and is attentive the entire week. The facilities were great and the instructors all knowledgeable and excited to teach. They also do a great job of knowing you came out to Alaska to see the beauty in addition to fly, and have ways of visiting challenging and beautiful lakes, allowing you to do both. My instructor, Sarah, did a great job and I loved each flight. Even when she was chastising me for forgetting something. (often....)
The entire team is great, though. Other instructors are so nice and quick to answer questions, ask you about yourself or provide insight they have picked up. Alex made sure our plane was ready for each and every flight, even fighting an early season snow storm! And the aircraft, while not shiny, new planes, are clearly well cared for by Don and Jason and I felt as safe in them as any I have flown. I really grew to enjoy flying the pacer. 
The exam was fair and in no way a gift. Don is very professional in his approach and does a great job making sure his instructors prepare you appropriately and challenges you accordingly. Not sure those pre-checkride jitters will ever go away.... 
In short, I can't recommend this place enough. I am so thankful I had people suggest it to me, and I can't wait to go back up for some bush flying and a commercial add-on!

review.author: Jordan M.
review.description: Great video upstairs about salmon and the proposed dam site that would be devastating to the progress of phasing out the traditional hydro dam practices.

review.author: Melinda M.
review.description: I walked in to get information on salmon viewing areas and the lady at the front desk was relay nice.m offering a lot more information about the area. They offer free river walks and have aquariums and play free movies. Cute store dedicated to salmon in a cute area!

review.author: Ashley C.
review.description:
I completed a 12-day mountaineering course with AMS last spring; I'd done some entry-level mountaineering in the Pacific Northwest, where I live, and this was my first expedition-style experience.  The trip truly exceeded my expectations.  I found that it was as much about learning to bond with your companions and learning how to live (cook, sleep, relax, appreciate the incredible nature around you) and be comfortable on a glacier for almost two weeks as it was about learning the technical skills including crevasse rescue and sled travel required for a trip like Denali.  It was nice to be eased into this type of environment without being forced to alpine start in the dark at all or exert yourself for really anything more than 8 hours at a time.  Our guides were some of the most hardworking, interesting people I've met and even taught us to build an igloo on our "snow day".  I liked that they emphasized learning independence early on (learning to use the MSR stoves, melting snow for water, planning meals and cooking our own food) opposed to the experience some other groups offer (I've been on REI backpacking trips where I'm sitting idly watching the guides cook dinner and don't prefer that). 

Given some of the negative reviews below, I do want to reflect for a minute on expectation setting for a trip such as this.  There are SO many factors outside of our control (weather, pandemic, availability of employees, to name a few) that I think it is a true wonder in the current age that one can sign up for an experience like this at what I found to be a fair price for what was provided (air travel onto glacier, provisions, gear, expert instruction, feeling secure on a guided trip) for nearly two weeks.  I felt that AMS' COVID policies were reasonable and well communicated, and as a healthcare worker I can acknowledge the risk a company takes on flying students of varying states of fitness, health, and age into a remote environment.  I purchased the insurance recommended by AMS just in case.

12 days is an extensive amount of time to choose to spend in a remote area, and I have a huge appreciation for the guides who make the sacrifices they do so that people like me can have such a tremendous experience.  Given the stressors in a place like Alaska, I certainly don't expect dynamics to be perfect at any time, so I was pleasantly surprised by how mature everyone in our group was and by how we got along.  We made some great memories - from the tough times pulling sleds up mountain passes roasting in the sun, to the chill times in camp cooking and "brunching" together, sharing stories.  This trip was the most impactful thing I've done in the last decade, hands down.  I look forward to keeping in touch with the folks I met, and to doing another trip with AMS in the future.

review.author: Nicole L.
review.description: My friend and I signed up for the 12 day winter mountaineering class. I've been wanting to do some independent expeditions in Alaska across different glaciers and I feel like now I have a great foundation for exploring more of our awesome state. I would sign up for another class for sure - their instructors are top-notch!!\nWe also met some amazing people in our group that we're still friends with. You can never have too many adventure partners.

review.author: Lizzie C.
review.description:
I only have good things to say about AMS and its staff!

I climbed Denali with them in the spring of 2022 and had an eventful but wonderful experience with AMS. My trip started with my flight to Alaska being cancelled on the morning of my departure, and the staff at AMS worked with me in order to ensure that I was still able to leave with my group despite arriving a full day behind schedule. 

Once on the mountain, our guides had to constantly adjust and work with other teams on the mountain, as several people in our group had health issues that forced them to turn back. One of the reasons that I had chosen AMS was their guide to client ratio which ultimately allowed the remaining climbers to still make the summit. I was so impressed by our guides' professionalism and efforts to ensure our safety and success. Nate, Hannah, and Ben made an amazing team, working together and with us as we worked our way up the mountain. I never felt unsafe and enjoyed learning from our guides' collective experience. 

Denali is not an easy or guaranteed climb, and I am so grateful to AMS and its entire staff for allowing me to experience and enjoy such a gorgeous mountain.

review.author: Varun R.
review.description:
I wrote an entire review that was lost by yelp when I went to log in. I am painstakingly rewriting this entire review now from my phone. Shame on yelp for being such a lousy service.

I climbed with AMS in 2021 and 2022. Ok 2021, I decided to turn back due to improper boot fitment. No fault of the guides or AMS.

In 2022, I did a custom expedition led by Colby Coombs. I have nothing but positive things to say about both Colby and AMS. He was a consumate professional and we summited in top form in just 11 days. He was polite, easy to get along with, and had an eye for safety the entire way up. 

Especially wrt safety. I have to hand it to AMS. The NPS rangers mentioned that AMS was a paragon for safety and professionalism, and after seeing how they operated on the mountain, I have to agree. Many times, Colby would clean up other climbers' trash left on the mountain, or advise climbers when he found them using unsafe technique, though it wasn't his responsibility to do so. I really felt like AMS were stewards of the mountain. 

Every decision he made on the mountain was done with safety as his top priority. From their HQ in Talkeetna to their guiding style and record, I found everything to be at the highest standard. I can't recommend them highly enough. 

I understand that since reviewers on here had some bad experiences, but my own experiences were stellar. 

Once week after we got back, Colby went back to Denali with my friend Julie and summitted with her. So that makes for three experiences with AMS I can vouch for.

review.author: Iulia Z.
review.description:
Alaska Mountaineering School (AMS) was a terrible experience and I would not recommend it to anyone!! I am a management consultant and a serious mountaineer (doing 4 mountains/ year with multiple international/ local companies) and have never had a worst experience. 
We were 6 participants on an expedition to summit Denali on 23-May 2019 and 5 of us had to return one day before the summit because we did not trust our Lead Guide (Con Severis and Second Guide (Chris Welch) to take us to the top due to safety problems as well as horrible/ inhuman client service. All the trip participants are experienced mountaineers and have hired many international and local guide companies. We are all well-versed with safety, service and professionalism standards. The Denali trip did not meet these standards. Below are some high level examples of what we experienced:

+Egregious Safety Concerns. There were numerous safety issues that put the participants at risk throughout the expedition. Just a couple of the examples include:
While guiding a roped team under strong wind conditions, the lead guide listened to loud music on his headphones, making him unable to hear his own roped team under strong wind conditions
While ordering an unnecessary and risky pass of another team, the lead guide demanded a client unhook from the fixed line and slide down a steep icy slope with only an ice axe.

+Denial of Summit For No Reason. We were denied the summit for no reason -- when the weather was good, there were no health or capability concerns, and the guide ratio exceeded Denali's standard guide ratio of 1:3.

+Unacceptable Client Treatment. The treatment of the participants was unprofessional and offensive throughout the expedition. The guides frequently screamed at the participants for no reason. The guides insulted us, calling us "spoiled brats".

After this happened, the owner of AMS, Colby Coombs completely ignored our concerns, did not reply for two months to emails sent from everyone in the team and then sent the same email to each one of us saying that he trusts his guide, with no further explanation. Do not go with Alaska Mountaineering School, we missed the summit because of their unprofessionalism and also had the worst customer experience (Colby Coombs, Constantine Severis)

review.author: Marv O.
review.description:
I would not recommend AMS. AMS--understandably--had to cancel 2020 Denali expeditions due to Covid. However, the company refused to refund my deposit even though the contract explicitly states "AMS reserves the right to cancel a Course or Expedition; in this unlikely event, paid deposit and balance will be refunded in full." 

AMS argues they are simply postponing to 2021. However, I'm not available to commit to a 2021 date at this time and the contract I signed listed a 2020 departure date. 

While I understand this is a difficult time for small businesses (and I offered to contribute some of my deposit), I don't think it's fair for the company to not honor the original contract we mutually signed. 

While I've heard AMS has good guides and is great at logistics on Denali, I would not want to be climbing with a company I can't fully trust.

review.author: Delia Z.
review.description:
I had a very bad experience with AMS the summer of 2019 and would strongly recommend you to not go with them if you want to summit Denali. Our lead guide, Con Severis, was constantly yelling, swearing at the entire group, leading while listening to loud music that made it impossible to communicate with him and not providing any instruction/help in critical moments to his rope team.

His behavior was not only highly unprofessional, but he also put us in several dangerous situations. He would become angry if we had a bad weather day and storm down steep hills and even asked another person in our group to untie from the fixed line and go down an icy slope holding only on his ice axe. We felt unsafe numerous times, scared to voice our concerns and felt treated very poorly.

We continued the trip nevertheless because we all wanted to summit. We were a group of 7, one of us had to go back because of frostbite, the remaining 6 of us got very close to last camp before summit at 16,000 feet. That's when Con told us that he won't take all of us to summit because there weren't enough guides. He had decided from day one according to him that only 3 people from our group will summit and now because 6 of us had made it he was going to turn back 3 of us to base camp even if we were feeling great, had no issues and the weather was good. Things went downhill from there and the group lost confidence in the guides' abilities and willingness to lead us to the summit - all of us except one chose to go down and not summit with Con as our guide because we thought it was very risky. It was honestly one of the hardest decisions I had to make in my life being so close to the summit we have been training for.

The responses from the manager and AMS to our complaints have been disappointing - they decided to place the blame on all of us and didn't even apologize. We are now considering to sue them.

Please feel free to reach out to me, I am happy to share more of my experience. From my experience, the guide company you choose is an important decision given how hard the mountain is and the high price investment. I am very sorry I chose AMS and I will regret this forever but I hope other climbers are aware.

review.author: Lisa N.
review.description: I used to fly with Don when I visited Alaska on both floats and skies (season dependent). And I still recommend him and Alaska Floats and Skis today. This place is awesome.

review.description:

The entire team is great, though. Other instructors are so nice and quick to answer questions, ask you about yourself or provide insight they have picked up. You can never have too many adventure partners.
